JobTitle: Principal Product Manager, Data Integration – Neural Dynamic...
Content_text:
Principal Product Manager, Data Integration – Neural Dynamics
The mission of the Allen Institute is to unlock the complexities of bioscience and advance our knowledge to improve human health. Using an open science, multi-scale, team-oriented approach, the Allen Institute focuses on accelerating foundational research, developing standards and models, and cultivating new ideas to make a broad, transformational impact on science.
The Allen Institute has been a leader in the field of neuroscience for over 17 years; in 2021 we are launching a new research division, the Allen Institute for Neural Dynamics, to understand how dynamic neuronal signals at the level of the entire brain implement fundamental computations and drive flexible behaviors.
We seek an experienced, user-oriented Principal Product Manager to maximize the impact of the data and tools produced by Allen Institute for Neural Dynamics. The ideal candidate will have practical experience with the complexities of collecting and analyzing large, multimodal biological data sets. Engaging deeply with both internal and external community stakeholders is essential to success in our Open Science mission. We seek a candidate who can guide the design of data, tools and standards and establish them in the broader neuroscience community. The ideal candidate will be focused on scientific and technical excellence, highly motivated, agile, and team oriented.
The Allen Institute believes that team science significantly benefits from the participation of diverse voices, experiences, and backgrounds. Progress in science benefits from multiple perspectives. We are committed to increasing diversity across every team and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for this role.
Essential Functions
Lead the design of an integration framework for neuroscience data and metadata, including neurophysiology, imaging, and behavior modalities
Standardize terminology, file formats, and data schema across multiple projects.
Guide the design of analysis tools and workflows, including integrations with third-party tools
High touch engagement with internal and external stakeholders to inform design decisions
Foster and manage community around Allen Institute for Neural Dynamics' data and tooling ecosystem

Required Education and Experience
7+ years of product development or related experience
BA/BS in Computer Science, neuroscience, or a related field, or equivalent combination of degree and experience

Preferred Education and Experience
PhD or Master’s degree in relevant field
Demonstrated strong data science skills
Experience collecting and analyzing large scale biological data sets
Working knowledge of neurophysiology concepts
Python and R programming skills
Strong publication record

Physical Demands
Fine motor movements in fingers/hands to operate computers and other office equipment; repetitive motion with lab equipment

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work
This role is currently able to work remotely due to COVID-19 and our focus on employee safety. We are a Washington State employer, and remote work must be performed in Washington State. We continue to evaluate the safest options for our employees. As restrictions are lifted in relation to COVID-19, this role will return to work onsite.

Additional Comments
**Please note, this opportunity offers relocation assistance**
**Please note, this opportunity does not offer work visa sponsorship**

It is the policy of the Allen Institute to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, the Allen Institute will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Products and Technology
Job Details
Data Scientist - Security - Senior/Lead
Job Details
Our Security Data Science team invents, builds and scales new ways to secure Salesforce enterprise and Salesforce platforms and products across multiple public cloud substrates. We use big data and machine learning to advance analytics and threat detection techniques of many forms. We own our solutions, from inception, through proof-of-concept, production-ready models, tuning and efficacy monitoring. We are a growing, highly visible, and highly agile team where experimentation, collaboration, and spirited discussion are the norm.
We are looking for an experienced, driven, and creative Senior or Lead Data Scientist to join the team. As a member of this team, you’ll research, formulate, build and test new techniques in threat detection and analysis. You’ll partner with threat specialists to understand evolving threat patterns and their detection. You’ll help develop statistical models and big data applications to identify anomalous or malicious behavior through mining vast sources of internal and external data. You’ll play a key role in championing your research and the larger teams’ with executive partners. You’ll provide periodic efficacy measurement, analysis, and reporting for deployed techniques.
About you
You’re intensely curious about data and highly adept in analyzing large volumes of data, then teasing out valuable signals therein. You’re able to seamlessly merge rigor in statistics with awareness of their application to business problems.
You thrive in researching, experimenting with, applying, and proving out new techniques in machine learning and data mining. You maintain a healthy curiosity and investment in keeping abreast of emerging techniques.
You collaborate effectively across various security teams and software engineers to champion proven detection techniques and detection efficacy.
Required Skills
PhD or Masters and 3+ years experience in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, or related quantitative field
Demonstrated experience in machine learning and data mining
Experience formulating and executing applied-research projects and assisting in their production implementation.
Strong fundamentals in applied statistics and probability
Facility with big data analytics tools and distributed systems, Apache Spark, Flink, or Kafka
Strong programming skills in Python, Java, or Scala
Excellent interpersonal skills
Prior knowledge of Security is not required

Preferred Skills
Experience in applying big-data techniques to security, specifically in anomaly detection, pattern recognition, behavior-based analysis, and correlation.
Good knowledge with network technologies, such as TCP/IP, DNS or load balancer
Prior experience in the security space
Experience with public cloud services (AWS or Google Cloud Platform or Azure)
LI-Y
Accommodations
If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .
Posting Statement
At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.
Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .
Salesforce welcomes all.
Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
As a federal contractor, Salesforce is required to verify that all US-based employees are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If you receive an offer and are unable to get vaccinated for religious or medical reasons, you may request a reasonable accommodation.

5+ years hands-on analytics work experience, with proven quantitative orientation.
Experience in leading complex large scale analytical solution implementation

Experience building measures and metrics, and developing reporting solutions

Job summary
Would you like to be part of the next big thing while it’s still day one? Do you love working with different data types from free text to telemetry, uncovering unknown insights about customers? Does the opportunity to unlock a huge opportunity excite you? If so, read on.

The Kindle Content and Physical Books team is seeking an experienced Business Intelligence Engineer to help set up and scale new analytics sources and methods. Our team is working on a global vision to improve the education of our communities by democratizing education through innovative eLearning products and services.
As part of a new initiative on a growing team, you will have the freedom to innovate and create lasting impact on customer experience.

Our team is seeking a self-driven BIE with broad technical and data management skills who will identify and onboard new data sources, conduct analytics, and build lightweight tools and methods for others to replicate and scale their work. You should have expertise in the design, creation, management, and business use of large datasets. Your solutions are testable, maintainable, and mindful of resource usage. You should be able to apply statistical methods (e.g. regression) to difficult business problems and understand these methods’ assumptions and limitations. You will need excellent business and communication skills to work with product managers and business owners on ambiguous problems in a fast paced environment to develop and define key business questions and requirements.

Key job responsibilities

Develop methods and metrics that provide insights to product teams and business owners
Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting/analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation
Write quality code to retrieve and analyze data
Develop pragmatic analyses and choose applicable solutions that add value to the business area
Understand data resources and know how, when, and which to use (and which not to use)
Use advanced analytical techniques to solve business problems
Continue to move forward in the face of ambiguity and imperfect data. Find a solution around the problem that still maintains a high analytical bar. You do not suffer from “analysis paralysis”.
Ensure that decisions are based on the merit of their unbiased analytical results, not the proposer. Stay “true to the data”.
Communicate analysis results and techniques, both verbally and in writing, clearly and confidently to peers and business partners.
Master’s degree or higher in Statistics, Data Science, or an equivalent quantitative field
7+ years of industry experience working as a BIE or related specialty
Experience using Cloud Storage and Computing technologies such as AWS Redshift, S3, Hadoop, etc.
Understanding of data warehousing and data modeling
Experience communicating results and business impact of analytical deep dives to senior leadership
Experience working as a BIE in a technology company
Strong written and verbal communication skills

Job summary
Do you love using data to solve complex supply chain problems? Are you interested in innovating and developing world-class business intelligence solutions? We have the career for you!

Amazon's Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) team is seeking a Business Analyst to join our Analytics team. We deliver business intelligence/data science solutions to a diverse community of internal customers dedicated to supply chain optimization and forecast accuracy. Amazon has culture of data-driven decision-making, and demands business intelligence that is timely, accurate, and actionable.

As a Business Analyst, you must possess the ability to dive deep into large amounts of data, have a great business sense, curiosity, a proven ability to deal with complexity, and the desire to influence key strategic decisions with data-driven analysis and insights. This role will play an integral part in defining and building critical business metrics, leveraging data and statistical methods to influence business strategy, and working as a valued thought partner to drive the operations across our rapidly growing and evolving fulfillment network.

The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, capable of working in a fast-paced environment, possess a strong attention to detail, and able to collaborate with internal customers to understand and transform business problems into requirements and deliverables.

Key job responsibilities

Use expertise in qualitative and quantitative analysis to deliver actionable insights to stakeholders
Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing and ad-hoc metrics, reports, and analyses that drive key business decisions
Define the data elements to enable analytical and reporting capabilities, and work cross-functionally with other business intelligence teams
Perform ad-hoc reporting and deep dive analysis in fast pace environment
Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting, analysis, data integrity, test design, validation, and documentation.
Build automated and scalable reports / dashboards to enable your team to self-service data needs, allowing you to focus on answering hard and ambiguous problems.
Explore and develop expertise with internal Amazon data services and public AWS products including Redshift, QuickSight and more

About the team
The broad mission of the S&OP team is to align and optimize the Fulfillment Center (FC) network plan for labor and capacity constraints, ideal placement and purchasing volumes. We partner with internal stakeholders to continuously improve plan accuracy, visibility and tools to automate the planning process. Every week we provide an accurate short to medium term aggregate fulfillment plan for the US and CA fulfillment network in order to make local planning decisions at the FCs.


Master’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics, Data Science or a related discipline.
Excellent written and verbal communications across technical and non-technical stakeholders
Experience with supply chain management concepts including planning, forecasting and optimization gained through work experience or graduate level education
Proficient in Python, R or similar programming language
Experience using AWS products (e.g., Redshift and QuickSight)

JobTitle: 3D Computer Vision and Machine Learning Engineer
Content_text:
Who We Are:
Headquartered in Redmond, Washington, MicroVision is part of the community of high-tech leaders in the Greater Seattle Area. Founded in 1993, early applications of our technology were incorporated into automotive systems and U.S. Military heads up displays. We’ve since worked with companies worldwide to successfully integrate our technology into their products and bring revolutionary solutions to market.
Job Summary:
MicroVision has an immediate opportunity for a 3D Computer Vision / Machine Learning Engineer. As a key member of the MicroVision's Software Engineering team, you will collaborate with various technical teams in the company to design and take into production market defining automotive lidar product. The right candidate for this position will be a highly motivated CV/ML engineer with a breadth of understanding of development and implementation of fast, efficient, low-latency algorithms for processing dense 3D point clouds with edge computing.
Essential Responsibilities:
Design, develop, implement, and evaluate novel computer vision and machine learning algorithms as applied to Advanced Driver Assistant Systems (ADAS) and Autonomous Vehicles (AV).
Work on large-scale datasets, focusing on building scalable and accurate computer perception systems.
Design and implement algorithms for semantic segmentation, object classification, and object velocity estimation based on 3D point cloud data.
Perform training, tuning, and hyperparameter optimization on deep learning models suitable for implementation on edge devices.
Collaborate closely with team members on developing systems from prototyping to production level.
Work closely with software, firmware and RTL teams to implement efficient real-time algorithms realizable in edge devices in embedded software or directly on Silicon.
Desired Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Experience in designing and applying efficient CV and ML algorithms for computer vision and/or computer perception applications.
Practical Computer Vision experience in areas of object detection, recognition, segmentation, 3D computer vision, and/or multi-object tracking.
Experience with Computer Vision frameworks, such as OpenCV, and Machine Learning frameworks, such as TensorFlow, Keras, or PyTorch.
Fluent in Python, proficient in C++.
Knowledge of digital filtering and 3D point cloud data conditioning for Computer Vision pipelines.
Experience with Perception algorithms for Automotive and Safety Critical Applications.
Education and Experience:
MSc degree in Computer Science, Math, Physics, or a related field and minimum of 1 year of relevant work experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
This position is not 100% Remote. MicroVision does offer a flexible work schedule that could include a hybrid type flexible work schedule (partial onsite; partial remote). Candidate must live and reside within a commuting distance from MicroVision's headquarters in Redmond, WA.
MicroVision is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. MicroVision is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, status as a disabled veteran or Vietnam-era veteran or any other basis prohibited by local, state, or federal law. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation in completing the application, attending and/or participating in an interview or in taking any test required for employment.

The Sr. Recruiter collaborates with HR Business Partners, hiring managers and business leaders to design and develop recruiting strategies to attract, assess and hire qualified candidates. In this role, you will manage the full cycle recruitment process for a portfolio technical and analytical roles (Data Science, Business Intelligence, Business Analytics, etc.).

This role works in a consultative manner with stakeholders to successfully source talent, promote the employer brand, provide recruiting and hiring metrics to assess the overall pipeline health, and manage the candidate experience. The Sr. Recruiter models effective interviewing techniques and provides coaching and training for hiring managers, recruiting peers and interview loop participants using legal and effective interview questions and assessment criteria.

What You’ll Do

Responsible for recruitment and talent acquisition process for all levels, with an emphasis on more experienced exempt-level roles, management positions and/or positions which require a higher level of technical expertise.
This includes sourcing passive candidates, engaging applicants, screening qualified candidates, facilitating candidate assessments, prepping candidates for interviews, facilitating debriefs, managing offer negotiations and closing selected candidates.
Develop and cultivate strong relationships with business leaders at all levels of the organization, hiring managers and HR colleagues to fully understand business needs and objectives in order to develop candidate profiles that match overall requirements and success factors for short and long-term talent needs of the business.
Coach hiring managers and interviewers on the recruitment process, interviewing skills, assessment techniques, and recruiting systems.
Collaborate with hiring managers and HR colleagues to develop job posting content that is thorough, compelling, and alluring to candidates and aligns with business strategy.
Collaborate with and coach (as needed) hiring managers on identifying key competencies, knowledge, skills, and abilities for open positions and provide consultation on specific interviewing questions and talent assessment activities to identify the right candidates.
Ensure a positive experience for all candidates for assigned requisitions by providing timely, accurate, relevant feedback to internal & external candidates.
Responsible for recruiting and hiring metrics; data management and integrity within an applicant tracking system and other HR systems; and compliance of federal and local employment laws and with internal policies and procedures.

What You Bring

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Human Resources or related field OR combination of education and equivalent work experience required
5+ years of recruiting experience in a corporate setting with at least 3 years of filling exempt-level analytical or technical positions which require passive sourcing
Must have proven success collaborating with hiring managers and developing recruitment strategies for passive job seekers, exhibiting creativity with candidate search & developing networks
Must possess consultative recruiting skills and be able to assist hiring managers in articulating the business needs for a role and to coach the manager through a successful and efficient hiring process
Must demonstrate excellent written and oral communication; critical listening skills; presentation skills and interpersonal skills

We are:
Applied Intelligence, the people who love using data to tell a story. We’re also the world’s largest team of data scientists, data engineers, and experts in machine learning and AI. A great day for us? Solving big problems using the latest tech, serious brain power, and deep knowledge of just about every industry. We believe a mix of data, analytics, automation, and responsible AI can do almost anything—spark digital metamorphoses, widen the range of what humans can do, and breathe life into smart products and services. Want to join our crew of sharp analytical minds? Visit us here to find out more about Applied Intelligence.
You are:
An expert ML Engineer with an eye for AI. You want to change how the world works and lives by taking AI out of the lab and into everyday life.
The work:
Develop custom models based on in-depth understanding of underlying data, data structures, and business problems to ensure analytics deliverables meet client needs
Prototype and demonstrate products for clients in customer environments.
Use your judgment to craft solutions to complex problems or seek guidance as needed
Report on your progress regularly in writing and face-to-face
 Stay up-to-date on new products that clients could use
Work with peers and senior colleagues in Accenture and at client companies

Here’s what you need:
Minimum 2 years of ML algorithms/solutions and expertise in Cloud platforms and IT systems which are necessary to execute data science algorithms in BAU client system and processes
 Minimum 3 years of developing machine learning methods, including familiarity with techniques in clustering, regression, optimization, recommendation, neural
Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience
Bonus points if:
 Experienced on Google Cloud Vertex AI; Google Cloud Machine Engineering Professional Certified
 Demonstrable knowledge building and scaling ML pipelines and engineering (KubeFlow, TFX etc.)

Job Description
VP - Real Time Analytics
Chase is transforming the way it interacts with customers by investing in data, analytics, and people. The goal is for Chase to become the undisputed leader in financial services by providing superior customer experience across all channels. The customers' experience should be consistent and highly-personalized, whether they choose to bank digitally - including Chase.com and the Chase Mobile App - or use an ATM, walk into a branch, call the automated system, or speak to a customer service representative.
The VP of Real Time Analytics will help create the framework for monitoring our customer behaviors in real-time dashboards and providing actionable recommendations to senior leaders. We are looking for an experienced data-driven leader that will own connecting to real-time data, analytics/dashboard priority, upholding standards/controls, and delivery of actionable recommendations to senior leaders. This role requires close interactions across various functions of the company.
Activities include:

Develop and document dashboard standards for Real-time Analytics
Collect end-to-end dashboard requirements for real-time KPIs, behaviors, customer experience, and product performance
Dashboard creation, maintenance, account provision and data capture optimization
Design and implement effective data processing architectures and implement design improvements in collaboration with our data and technology partners.
Summarize large volumes of streaming data into meaningful graphs and reports.
Prioritize analyses, develop tactical approaches, and manage analyst work streams.
Present findings and recommendations for action to partners and leaders within the company
Follow recommended actions through to implementation - track if the change resulted in an improved customer experience and met the stated goal/value.
Work cross-functionally with peers in technology, product, and other critical functions to develop a holistic view of performance and growth opportunities

Qualifications:

7-10+ years in hands-on data analytics experience.
5+ years' experience with data visualization tools for real-time analysis such as Splunk, Tableau, etc.
5+ Experience connecting, aggregating, and architecting data for use in dashboards
Working knowledge of building dashboards using streaming and/or near-real-time data
Technical ability to understand, design, and explain complex real-time data strategies to both a business audience and a data science or analytic user base
Hands-on experience in customer experience analysis (domain knowledge across one or many including: web analytics, customer segmentation analysis, contact center analysis, marketing analytics, etc.)
Strong problem solving, and analytical skills combined with the ability to synthesize and effectively communicate findings to peers and leaders in the organization
Inspiring team leadership and interpersonal skills, with an emphasis on transparency, fostering teamwork, promoting exceptionalism, and modeling high integrity

Chase is a leading financial services firm, helping nearly half of America's households and small businesses achieve their financial goals through a broad range of financial products. Our mission is to create engaged, lifelong relationships and put our customers at the heart of everything we do. Summary
Posted: Dec 4, 2021
Role Number: 200319371
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there’s no telling what you could accomplish. The Apple AI/ML Information Intelligence team is looking for both strong software engineers to design, build and optimize core systems for powering privacy-aware on-device search on the home screen and across the system apps on iOS and macOS. You will be part of a team that partners with apps and other teams across apple to enable new best-in-class search experiences for users. The ideal candidate should be excited about building storage, indexing and search system that are powerful enough to support a wide range of user experiences, and yet responsive and efficient enough to run on any device. The expected impact of your work will be to delight millions of Apple customers who rely on Apple devices for every aspect of daily life.
Key Qualifications
Strong coding and software engineering skills
Strong background in computer science: algorithms, data structures, system design
Proficiency in Go, C, C++, Java, Objective-C or other generalist programming languages
Strong communication skills
Description
You will work on the core storage, indexing and search systems that power on-device Spotlight search over data on all iOS and macOS devices. You will build new components that power new search experiences in close partnership with search ranking teams and many other teams at Apple. You are passionate about building performant and well-designed systems, are able to learn existing systems quickly to understand how to bring them to the next level. You are willing to work on diverse projects, ranging from performance optimization and understanding systems behavior, to refactoring and extending APIs to enable new search features for users.
Education & Experience
BS, MS, Ph.D. in a related field, or equivalent experience
Additional Requirements
Experience with data management and indexing systems a plus
Experience with optimization (CPU, memory and storage) a plus
Experience with iOS or macOS development a plus
An appreciation for good API design
Ability to write correct, clear, and understandable code
Ability to learn new technologies quickly
Excellent communication and teamwork skills

8+ years of finance experience or a related analytical field.
BA/BS in Finance, Accounting, Business, Economics, or a highly analytical field (e.g., Engineering, Math, and Computer Science)

Amazon Customer Engagement Finance seeks a Finance Manager to support the Customer Behavior Analytics (CBA) team, which is responsible for generating Downstream Impact metrics (DSI), customer understanding and insights, Customer Targeting applications, and Marketing Attribution. Products that CBA develop are built from the ground up, and utilize cutting edge technologies that fuse Big Data with concepts from Machine Learning, Economics and other fields like Data Science. These innovations help make strategic investment decisions and define the customer engagement metrics by which Amazon runs its business globally. This role will influence the teams that engage with products and decision making that make customer messaging more personal.

The Finance Manager would partner with the CBA, business, and tech teams, providing financial guidance and controllership for the use of CBA tools across Amazon. S/he has a passion for learning about complex econometric models and communicating to a non-technical audience in a crisp manner. The successful candidate will possess potent communication and influencing skills, and have a passion for using data to drive business decisions. We are looking for a self-starter that attacks complex business problems with curiosity and dives deep to identify root causes. This individual thrives by providing data-driven decision support and business intelligence that is timely, accurate, and actionable to senior leaders across various Amazon business.

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.


MBA or Master’s degree in finance, accounting, economics, or related field
Advanced knowledge of Excel
Knowledge of SQL is desirable
Strong analytical, financial modeling and reporting skills and a passion for complex problem solving
Demonstrated ability to work independently and self-motivate in a fast paced and rapidly-changing environment, to influence decisions through effective verbal and written communication

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field.

5+ years of experience in Security Operations using performing Incident response, forensics and analysis. Expertise in writing run books, and complexity analysis.
Runs vulnerability scans and reviews vulnerability assessment reports. Manages and configures security monitoring tools (netflows, IDS, correlation rules, etc.).
Strong experience in security engineering and network technologies (PCAP, Netflow), Operating Systems and network security, common attack patterns and exploitation techniques.
Practical knowledge of system security analysis techniques such as threat modeling, attack graphs, etc…
Data Science techniques such as clustering, anomaly detection, and machine learning leveraging data analysis tools such as OSSEC, Splunk, Behavioral Analytics, SQL, R, or MatLab
Knowledge of network and web related protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, UDP, IPSEC, HTTP, HTTPS, routing protocols).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

The Team: Go is a new kind of store with no lines and no checkout—you just grab and go! Customers simply use the Amazon Go app to enter the store, take what they want from our selection of fresh, delicious meals and grocery essentials, and go!

Our checkout-free shopping experience is made possible by our Just Walk Out Technology, which automatically detects when products are taken from or returned to the shelves and keeps track of them in a virtual cart. When you are done shopping, you can just leave the store. Shortly after, we will charge your Amazon account and send you a receipt. Check it out at amazon.com/go. Designed and custom-built by Amazonians, our Just Walk Out Technology uses a variety of technologies including computer vision, sensor fusion, and advanced machine learning. Innovation is part of our DNA! Our goal is to be Earths' most customer centric company, and we are just getting started. We need people who want to join an ambitious program that continues to push the state of the art in computer vision, machine learning, distributed systems and hardware design.

The Role: As a SIRT Security Engineer you will help ensure our applications and services are designed and implemented to the highest standards. If you enjoy analyzing the security of applications and services, discovering and addressing security issues and quickly reacting to new threat scenarios, this position will provide you with a challenging opportunity. You will participate in security audits, risk analysis, vulnerability testing and security reviews across all elements of this project's software systems.

This role will draw on multiple disciplines:

Incident Response: Fully analyze network and host activity on incident response situations, including best practices tools and creation of custom tool sets and scripts. Coordinate critical and sensitive incident response engagements spanning multiple geographies. Conduct briefings on the outcome of threat hunting and incident response operations to a broad spectrum of audiences, ranging from technical teams to executive management.
Threat Hunting: To be able to conduct Threat Hunting operations, and assess the risk on the findings on them, using known adversary TTPs (Tactics, Techniques and Procedures). Coordinate critical and sensitive cyber threat hunting engagements spanning multiple geographies.
Forensics: Conduct Incident response and Forensics analysis on EC2 instances given a "known-good" baseline. Conduct Incident response and forensics analysis on AWS accounts given a "known-good" baseline, configuration and policies.
Security Engineering: Emphasis on operating systems and networking, foundational Internet services, modern exploitation techniques, and hacking tools. The ability to incorporate new requirements into an existing solution.
Threat Intelligence: To be able to gather Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) and classified reports to detect, response and defeat advanced persistent threats (APT)

You will tackle challenging, novel situations every day and given the size of this initiative, you’ll have the opportunity to work with multiple technical teams at Amazon in different locations. You should be comfortable with a high degree of ambiguity and relish the idea of solving problems that haven’t been solved at scale before. Along the way, we guarantee that you’ll learn a ton, have fun and make a positive impact on millions of people.


Security certifications (CISSP, GCIA GCIH, GCFA, GCFE, etc.)
Master’s or PhD in Computer Science or related field.
Experience with Security Operations, Incident Response, Threat Hunting and Assurance methodologies e.g. fuzzing, static and dynamic code analysis.
Experience with common attack patterns and exploitation techniques. Ability to write fully functional exploits for common vulnerabilities such as simple stack overflow, cross-site scripting, or SQL injection.
Experience in using standard Security Assessment and Penetration Testing tools such as BurpSuite, Metasploit, and IDA Pro.
Knowledge of technical security issues facing large multinational companies.

Founded in 2012, ByteDance is a technology company operating a range of content platforms that inform, educate, entertain and inspire people across languages, cultures and geographies.

With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Douyin, Toutiao, Helo and Resso, ByteDance now has a portfolio of applications available in over 150 markets and 75 languages.

The mission of our AML team is to push next-generation machine learning algorithms and platform for the company. We also drive substantial impact for core businesses of the company. Currently we are looking for Research Scientist, Natural Language Processing to join our team to support and advance that mission.

What You'll Do
1. Conduct cutting-edge research in machine learning algorithms.
2. Apply machine learning algorithms to improve the different business scenarios, such as search ranking, natural language and video understanding, and trust and safety.
1. Published papers at top conferences like ICML, NIPS, ICLR, RecSys and KDD.
2. Proficient in C/C++, and have solid programming skills.
3. Familiar with at least one of the mainstream deep learning frameworks, like TensorFlow, Caffe or MXNet; familiar with their underlying frameworks and implementation mechanisms.
4. Familiar with deep learning algorithms like CNN/RNN/LSTM/VAE.
5. Able to solve problems independently, good teamwork and communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications:
1. Experience in contributing open sourced deep learning framework.
2. Familiar with the parallelization of sparse FTRL, FFM, and deep models on large-scale coefficient data.
3. Familiar with reinforcement learning.
4. Experience in resource management and task scheduling with large distributed software like Spark and TensorFlow.

PositionScientist – Deep Learning (Computational Protein Design)DescriptionWant to join a team that is redefining innovation in industrial biotech? Arzeda has developed a proven technology platform that merges computational protein design, machine learning, and high-throughput testing to produce novel proteins and enzymes more efficiently than even Mother Nature. Leveraging our core expertise we design novel proteins and bio-catalytic processes for the sustainable production of performance ingredients and materials. A deep tech, mission-driven company, we are passionate about our mission to design novel proteins and products that enhance our lives and protect our planet.We are seeking a talented Deep Learning (DL) Scientist to join our world-class Computational Protein Design team to push the envelope on novel DL methods for protein design. You will take a leadership role in the development of DL methods, as well as apply those methods directly to challenging industrial protein design problems, see the tangible results in the laboratory, and use those results to further improve the methods. By bringing your creativity, expertise, and passion to bear, you will play an integral role in achieving Arzeda’s vision for a cleaner, more sustainable future through protein design and synthetic biology.The preferred work location for this position is Seattle, Washington. However, remote work from other U.S. locations is a possibility. The position comes with a competitive salary and benefits, including health insurance, dental insurance, and paid time off, commensurate with applicant qualifications.ResponsibilitiesDevelop deep learning methods for enzyme and protein design.Perform protein design in production using DL methods.Analyze experimental data generated from proteins designed by DL methods to iteratively improve the methods.Participate in the development of Arzeda’s protein design platform, including automation and scale-up.QualificationsA PhD (or equivalent experience) in computer science, machine learning, computational biology, biochemistry, chemistry, structural biology, or a related field is required.A visible track record in deep learning is required, with demonstrated experience in the latest techniques in language modeling, graph neural networks, or equivariant neural networks.Proficiency in PyTorch or a similar deep learning framework is required.Proven experience using deep learning methods as applied to structural biology or computational chemistry is highly desirable.Inquiries and ApplicationsFor further information or to apply, please send your CV and a cover letter to andrew.ban[at]arzeda.com with the subject line “Scientist – Deep Learning”.Arzeda Corp. JobTitle: Software Development Engineer II, Robotics AI
Content_text:
2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience
Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.
Bachelor’s Degree or greater in Computer Science/Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or equivalent.
3+ years of industry software development experience, with background in design patterns, data structures, and test-driven development.
Proficiency developing production-quality software in languages such as C++, Python, or Java.
Proficiency with professional software engineering practices & standard practices for the full software life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
Experience in software design and architecture.
Excellent interpersonal and written communication skills.

Job summary
Are you excited about building high-performance robotic systems that can perceive, learn, and act intelligently alongside humans? The Robotics AI team is creating new products and technologies that make this possible, at Amazon scale.
The Robotics AI software team is seeking broad, curious engineers to join our diverse, full-stack team. In addition to holistically designing, building, and delivering end-to-end robotic systems, our team is responsible for the core infrastructure and tools that serve as the backbone of our robotic applications, enabling roboticists, machine learning scientists, and software engineers to collaborate and deploy systems in the lab and in the field. Our work spans real-time software, machine learning engineering, big data, simulation, and more.

Responsibilities:

Architect, design, and implement robotic software applications, infrastructure, and tools.
Work with stakeholders across hardware, science, and operations teams to iterate on systems design and implementation.
Create robust, high-quality, well-tested software to interface with and control sensors, actuators, and other hardware.
Collaborate with machine learning and robotic controls experts to implement and deploy algorithms, such as machine learning models.
Profile, tune, and optimize system performance.
Create re-usable software and systems to accelerate robotics development.
Maintain high standards by participating in reviews, designing for fault tolerance and operational excellence, and creating mechanisms for continuous improvement.
Mentor junior team members.

Responsibilities:

Architect, design, and implement robotic software applications, infrastructure, and tools.
Work with stakeholders across hardware, science, and operations teams to iterate on systems design and implementation.
Create robust, high-quality, well-tested software to interface with and control sensors, actuators, and other hardware.
Collaborate with machine learning and robotic controls experts to implement and deploy algorithms, such as machine learning models.
Profile, tune, and optimize system performance.
Create re-usable software and systems to accelerate robotics development.
Maintain high standards by participating in reviews, designing for fault tolerance and operational excellence, and creating mechanisms for continuous improvement.
Mentor junior team members.

Key job responsibilities
Architect, implement, and integrate alternative process paths/critical peripheral hardware-software systems into a mechatronic solution.
Design and implement simulation, automation, and optimization systems.


Master’s or advanced Degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or equivalent.
5+ years of industry software development experience, with background in design patterns, data structures, and test-driven development.
Experience in one or more relevant technical areas: robotics, computer vision, machine learning, sensors, real-time systems, embedded systems, distributed systems, simulation, high-performance scientific computing, or building infrastructure for engineering/science users.
Expertise in machine learning tool chains and techniques, such as TensorFlow or MxNet.
Expertise building and testing real-time or safety-critical systems, such as aerospace, automotive, or medical devices.
Experience with interdisciplinary developments that involve hardware, software, and algorithm co-design.
Experience supporting large-scale infrastructure and tool development for scientific/engineering users.
Solid fundamentals in operating systems, embedded systems, or systems programming.
Demonstrable experience in building, programming and integrating software and hardware for robotic systems.
Independent and ability to work with minimal direction.
Demonstrated experience incubating and productionizing new technology, working closely with research scientists and technical teams from idea generation through implementation.

Why We’re Rad (about us):
Rad Power Bikes, America’s largest electric bike brand, is on a mission to get people onto bikes that are built for everything and priced for everyone.
Our company is a driving force behind the e-bike market expansion in North America, and we’re growing rapidly in Europe. We are the first mover in the omnichannel retail space for personal mobility products and we continue to develop industry-leading, innovative e-bikes. Rad Power Bikes has grown to 700 employees today with 350,000+ customers, leading a global revolution in low carbon mobility.
We are looking for RADICAL people to join our global teams: Responsible, Approachable, Diverse, Innovative, Customer-Driven, Accountable, and always Learning.
We are looking for a Director - Data Engineering to architect and build our enterprise data warehouse and data analytics. This includes building a strategic roadmap for the next 3 years to address data and BI needs for every department from finance to supply chain. You will lead a team of Sr. Data engineers and Sr. Data analysts as they work on functions like Data Platforming, Data Delivery, Business Intelligence and Data Science. The ideal candidate will have a successful track record of managing data teams that lead and deliver complex data pipelines, data models and warehouses, collaborating with multiple departments and stakeholders in addressing their data needs, as well as the ability to lead change and communicate with a wide variety of audiences, both technical and business.
Why You’re Rad (about you):
10+ years of experience in a leadership role leading and managing data warehouses with significant data volumes and complex retail datasets
Comfortable with architecting from scratch, using industry leading platforms to support rapidly changing business requirements and high growth
5+ years of experience managing teams of data engineers, data scientists, data analytics and ETL developers
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, continuous integration/deployments, testing, and operations
Lead the design, analysis, and data architecture efforts for real-time services and big data platforms to solve complex business problems
Define data standards for use across the RAD’s technology stack
Experience working with BI platforms such as PowerBI, Tableau, Google’s Data Studio and Superset in some of the following areas: data modeling, data infrastructure, statistics, financial reporting, forecasting, attribution modeling, and test design
Experience turning user data into personalized, contextual, real-time insights to power customer interactions and acquisitions.
Strategic design mindset with a successful track record of translating business vision to measurable, trackable data outputs.
Assist in the transformation of high volume complex data structures into relevant information that can be used by Data Scientists, BI Analysts, and the business
Expert in system architecture, functionality, and data flow as well as operations, processes, and tools. Leverage business and application knowledge to create flexible and robust data solutions
Create and maintain a robust data dictionary and facilitate user adoption
Additional Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Computer Engineering or equivalent work experience with outstanding SQL skills
Broad experience with Data Warehouse platforms including Google’s BigQuery, Snowflake, and integration technologies like Stitch, Fivetran, etc
Strong understanding of DevOps practices with a good understanding of AWS and Google Cloud infrastructure supporting data, data science
You get bonus points for:
Data science architecture and implementation experience, working familiarity with open source software packages
Python and other data science software languages
Experience working in consumer retail, specifically with Shopify’s systems and API
Experience with cloud-based ERPs (e.g. Oracle Netsuite) and Warehouse Management Systems (GraphQL, BigQuery, and Postgres)
Open-source contributions and personal projects you’ve shipped successfully
Project management experience
Had you been with us last month, you would have:
Developed business intelligence and reporting solutions
Utilized and built out the data warehouse foundation and set up the pipes for data sources
Managed the building of data and documentation across company wide systems
Worked cross functionally with all teams, including Supply Chain, Customer Experience, etc. to capture and report on inventory data
Evaluated the feasibility and effectiveness of proposed data solutions
Designed schemas, optimized data transformation, and managed deployments and maintenance of the data pipeline
Completed end-to-end administration and maintained tools, systems, pipelines, and ETLs
Communicated designs, issues, and trade-offs to stakeholders, handled 3rd party vendors, and managed the relationships while troubleshooting high-level issues
Helped develop the foundational data stores that power our internal/external web apps and reporting systems

Accountable, we take ownership, bias to action, seek and provide feedback

Does this sound like you? Please apply and join us!

About Assurance
At Assurance we are disrupting the antiquated and inefficient world of insurance and financial services. Our team of world class software engineers, data scientists, business and finance professionals are modernizing how people obtain and manage their financial life all through our powerful platform ecosystem. Founded only 5 years ago, the company has grown rapidly, achieving more than $375M of revenue in 2020. We are continuing our rapid growth as we expand our product offerings and footprint, which continues to present new and exciting challenges as we push our industry into its future. We eliminate waste throughout the industry and provide a better buying experience, making the complex simple and providing valuable solutions to improve people's lives. We are humble, driven, and committed to improving the lives of millions.
The Assurance Finance team is seeking a Financial Analyst that thrives in a fast-paced, analytical, collaborative environment, supporting an innovative and rapidly growing company. The Finance Analyst will report to the FP&A Director of the Life business and will play an important role in supporting the multi-year forecast process, the preparation of C suite-level performance reporting, building out technology-enabled forecasting capabilities, as well as ad hoc strategic projects and analyses to help the business achieve its growth objectives.
In this role, the successful candidate will gain an understanding of the business, its value drivers, economics, products, and customer perspective; all while helping drive operational and financial strategic initiatives with data-driven analysis and insights. The successful candidate will partner effectively across the organization including Marketing, Data Science, Product Management, and Distribution to enhance the accuracy and efficiency of the projections and establish the roadmap for achieving the business’s financial objectives. The candidate will also be a key member of the team who will be building new technology and forecasting tools to improve business transparency, analytics, and automation.
Both Assurance and its Finance team are built upon a foundation of world-class technology, data science, and human talent that are combined to solve tough business problems through the generation of insights and execution. The successful candidate thrives in an ever-changing environment and loves to dive deep into the details to draw insights that drive valuable business outcomes.
Responsibilities
Utilize sophisticated data and BI tools, including Tableau and Looker, to analyze large scale datasets and translate business problems into operating financial models to drive business recommendations
Enhance and maintain financial models for the Life insurance line of business
Assist in quarterly forecasting financial reporting consolidation to tell the Assurance growth story
Help lead forecast transformation initiatives leveraging advanced software tools
Develop and analyze daily and weekly marketing lead supply/demand projections
Monitor daily performance across business lines and build/enhance dashboards to assist in performance management
Support competitor analytics
Identify and implement areas of improvements and efficiency
Ad hoc analysis and projects
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree required - preferably in Business, Finance, Economics, Accounting, or a related quantitative field (CFA, CPA, MBA, or progress towards preferred)
2- 3 years of experience in finance or accounting
Experience with database and BI tools such as SQL query, Tableau, Power BI, and Looker
Advanced Excel and modeling skills with demonstrated capabilities
Strong communication, presentation, and PowerPoint skills
Preferred Experience and Attributes
Open minded, curious, and eager to learn
Detail-oriented with the ability to work independently
Ability to apply critical thinking and analytic skills to formulate recommendations and resolve problems
Ability to grasp and apply new concepts quickly
Collaborative and team-oriented, able to work effectively with cross-functional teams
Ability to effectively prioritize concurrent responsibilities and meet timelines
Choose Assurance Because:Exceptional base salary plus bonus structureComprehensive benefits which include, medical, dental, vision, 401K and moreUnlimited paid vacation, sick leave, plus paid holidays.Growth opportunities, advance your career rapidly, we offer leadership development training and promote from within.Ongoing coaching and career development including individual and group coaching sessions.Fast paced, high performance environment.

Description
We are seeking an Application Services Developer/Analyst to help lead and execute technology transformation within the Transportation space of Weyerhaeuser’s US Timberlands. The core responsibility of this role is partnering with business operations to maximize our trucking asset utilization through the configuration, tuning, and use of a heuristic optimization model. You will collaborate daily with a wide array of stakeholders to support current implementations of the model, on top of forging new relationships across the organization as you help expand use of the model to additional operating areas. Developing a deep understanding of the model – capabilities, behavior, and outputs – will be essential, as well as the ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

As part of the Weyerhaeuser family, you will be joining a dynamic IT Product team made up of a diverse group of individuals with unique backgrounds, experience, and skills. Collaborating with your team and supporting one another will be core to your day-to-day role. Other responsibilities will include support activities for gathering, documenting, and communicating business functionality as it relates to our transportation applications and supply-chain processes within our Timberlands business. Your role will include application support across mobility, transportation operations, as well as end-user training and engagement.
As an Application Services Developer/Analyst, you will have a customer-focused, analytical approach you’re your business partners and IT teammates. This includes following IT standards and processes for incident, problem resolution, and change implementation. Building strong relationships with your business partners and understanding the importance of delivering data and process standards across vendor-provided and custom developed systems will be critical.
This is an exciting and unique role that combines working daily with customers on solutions and business process improvements, and the opportunity to gain deep knowledge of the technology and business domains of Weyerhaeuser Timberlands.
This position will have flexibility to report out of Weyerhaeuser’s Seattle Headquarters, from a US Timberlands operations location, or remotely from a home office.
Key Functions
Gain a deep understanding of log truck optimization, model tuning, and testing
Configure applications to enable business operations and strategy
Analyze customer requests and determine functional solutions that incorporate end-to-end business processes across multiple applications.
Work with other IT teams to ensure application interfaces are working and analyze new application integrations.
Work across enterprise IT groups and with external vendors to enhance application delivery for incident, problem and change enhancements in key functional requirements.
Create and maintain application documentation including process & data flows.
Be self-motivated, with an unmistakable bias for action, results, and continuous self-improvement and growth.
Maintain a strong knowledge and passion of IT solutions, new technologies and technology trends.
Coordinate review of inputs/outputs with internal and external customers and suppliers.
Support training efforts, including creation and delivery of training content to end users
Participate in and help lead project implementation for new functions or changes as they are released to end users.

Qualifications
At least 5 years of relevant IT experience in resource or plan optimization, heuristic modeling, or supply chain transportation.
Relevant experience, education or training in the field of computer science, data science, or statistical modeling
Prior focus in the area of forestry, natural resources, transportation or supply chain management
Excellent communication skills, especially in effectively communicating technical concepts to a non-technical audience.
Ability to interact effectively with customers, peers, and management in person and over the phone for remote support.
Excellent written and verbal communication, presentation, and facilitation skills.
Ability to prioritize workload to manage competing deadlines.
Demonstrated progression in work responsibilities with the capability and potential to grow beyond this role.
Up to 20% travel to Timberlands field operations for business partner engagement and project implementations.
Demonstrated ability to perform business analysis, develop solutions for improvement, and documenting technical requirements.

Beneficial Skills and Experience
Process & data standardization.
ITIL, Lean, Agile, and Scrum processes.
Transportation or supply chain operations.
SQL database design, analysis, and scripting.
Data analysis and reporting; Power BI.

We know you have a choice in your career. We want you to choose us.

We are committed to recruiting a diverse workforce and supporting an equitable and inclusive environment that inspires people of all backgrounds to join, stay and thrive with our team.

The Enterprise Products team is seeking an experienced, insightful and forward-thinking Program Manager to identify, design and implement efficient and effective Product Operations programs. In this role, your primary responsibility will be to develop and facilitate sound program management practices in support of the Enterprise Products organization, including: scoping, initiating and managing programs and related project portfolios, providing program management support to application pillars, and effective management of a growing team of contingent support engineers and specialists. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in managing complex programs, strategic and tactical execution of business processes, a good understanding of project management in critical environments, and strong working knowledge of an IT organization. JobTitle: newSenior/Lead Software Engineer, Web Development, Machine Lear...
Content_text:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Products and Technology
Job Details
Tableau has become the world's leading analytics platform by helping people see and understand their data. Increasingly, to understand their data, organizations are looking to develop and deploy predictive models to drive better and faster decisions. But ML is only useful when teams can answer the right questions, with clean reliable data, and deliver predictions seamlessly into business workflows. Tableau’s approach to this problem is called Business Science, and our goal is to help more people and organizations succeed with ML through intuitive and powerful modeling experiences that emphasize collaboration and models that are built close to where the business needs them.


In the Business Science team, we are building a new experience to bring enterprise scale machine learning modeling techniques into the hands of the data domain experts. This will allow rich collaboration across organizations, letting people with different expertise and backgrounds have a voice in the process, and allowing for model explanation and evaluation. Our team handles tough back-end challenges, but also has a strong focus on creating a delightful UI for our customers.



In this role you will:
Design and implement cross-platform features and products
Make technical decisions for key features on the team’s roadmap
Provide technical guidance and support to a vibrant engineering team
Innovate Tableau code base and technologies
Help designing new User Experience with product owner, UX designer, and customers
Improve and instill engineering practices
Drive collaboration with partner teams across Tableau Development organization
Work in a fast paced, agile environment
Master the products and learning how our customers use Tableau and Salesforce

Who you are:

Experienced . You have extensive experience developing exceptional quality and easy to use commercial software. You know how to make UI that feels effortless to the user. You have an understanding of web server architecture. You have an excellent grasp of at least one object-oriented language such as C++ or Java. You have strong front-end fundamentals, with experience using a JavaScript frameworks like React. Familiarity with Data Science and Machine Learning is a plus.
Educated . You have a solid foundation of computer science and software development fundamentals established through learning and experience.
Technical Leader . You lead by example a group of distributed engineers driving features from ideation through development to monitoring and maintenance after release. You enjoy collaborating, learning from experts, and consistently providing technical guidance to team members.
Maintain High Standards . You love building great products. You are passionate about maintaining high code quality. You hold the team to a high standard through code reviews. You believe in writing tests for your own code. You are able to identify areas for improvement and work on bringing about positive change over time.
Strong Communicator . You distill complex technical information down to the key elements and communicate both design ideas and technical details effectively. You understand your audience and adapt your presentation to the right level of detail.
Customer-focused . You have a habit of thinking from a customer’s perspective. The overall user experience of a product is important to you. You are eager to help identify and solve potential problems our customers might encounter in the field.
Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders, and in this role, you will be asked to be on the lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world!
Accommodations
If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .

Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .
Salesforce welcomes all.
As a federal contractor, Salesforce is required to verify that all US-based employees are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If you receive an offer and are unable to get vaccinated for religious or medical reasons, you may request a reasonable accommodation.

Principal Data Scientist, Product Analytics
The Corporate Systems team is responsible for an array of enterprise software, devices and services that shape and create the employee experience at Expedia Group. From office technology and collaboration tools to end point security and asset governance, this team provides an exceptional global offering that will allow employees everywhere to thrive in the hybrid workplace.
The Product Management team within Corporate Systems drives roadmaps and product strategy across this large portfolio. Our aim is to delight employees and improve their productivity by eliminating friction and simplifying the ecosystem they interact with daily. We are in search of a highly passionate individual to help advise these strategic decisions based on meaningful data, user behaviors and insights.
What you’ll do:
You will build end-to-end design of models based on detailed understanding of business requirements, including general approach, choice of algorithm and data sources
You will be an authority in more than one major ML programming language (Python, R, Scala…) and familiar with others
You will adapt and modify existing advanced models, techniques, and algorithms to suit specific business needs
You will design sophisticated statistical approaches when existing methods aren’t suited for the problem at hand
You will manage various partners and key contributors with frequent communication, expectation management, and minimal surprises
You will showcase expertise in big data architecture and relational database models
You will creatively design and build data visualization, applying experience and advanced knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript and APIs
You will make recommendations for improvement on business processes, sponsoring and staging workshops/ knowledge sessions to improve the organization's functional knowledge and acuity and using insights to overcome challenges
Who you are:
Bachelor's, Master’s, PhD, or Equivalent Experience; Mathematics, Science, Statistics degree, or a related technical field; or Equivalent related professional experience is applicable
Experience with web analytics and BI tools (i.e., Omniture, Tableau, Power BI)
An indispensable and highly influential leader who is experienced in an analytical capability, having coached, or led other analytical professionals previously
Translates vague business requirements into analytics projects and product enhancements for engineering teams
Assists with strategic projects and change initiatives of the wider group where needed
Coaches’ senior individual contributors in their skills and regularly engages with executive (VP/SVP+) leadership
Lead analytical programs delivering great outcomes, involving multiple product portfolios
Define analytics/data science standard methodologies at a team/capability level
You will demonstrate expert knowledge of typography and accessibility issues

Expedia Group (NASDAQ: EXPE) powers travel for everyone, everywhere through our global platform. Driven by the core belief that travel is a force for good, we help people experience the world in new ways and build lasting connections. Senior SEO Analyst

Come drive Organic Growth at one of the world’s largest retailers. The SEO team is responsible for all Organic Search traffic. We are building a world-class organic search practice, combining a mix of product excellence (to build features that engage organic visitors), technical marketing (to identify new user intents and opportunities), and content science (to create high quality content at scale). As a senior analyst you’ll lead the strategy, execution, and own results for a vertical (eg. Furniture), brand (eg. AllModern) or engineering team (eg. content science). This entails identifying new opportunities, monitoring performance, furthering our understanding of the levers of SEO, and driving the pipeline of features, tools and tests we launch every month. As part of the SEO team, you’ll collaborate with a dedicated team of content, product and engineering experts. You'll cover a broad scope. In a given quarter you might find yourself launching features that boost semantic richness, investigating Google algo changes, optimizing the creation of programmatic pages, or advising the organic growth strategy of a billion dollar business. In no time you’ll be driving millions of new organic visits, and have gained a uniquely valuable expertise.

What You'll Do
Identify new traffic opportunities and unmet user intents
Build a pipeline of new features improving organic landing experiences and rankings
Design test plans to further our understanding of the levers of SEO
Apply NLP and other advanced models to improve page quality and relevance
Lead the research and insight implementation from activities including: competitor analysis, site audits, opportunity analysis, content strategy, merchandise planograms, and more.
Own measurement and performance reporting for your respective brand/vertical/product area
Coach brands/verticals at Wayfair to help them grow organically
What You'll Need
2+ years working in quantitative-driven, service fields like consulting, technical marketing, data science, etc.
1+ years experience in SEO a definite plus
Intellectually curious and persistent
Experience manipulating large datasets such as server logs
Effective communicator
Team player
Fundamental understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and how the web works
Coding and prototyping skills a plus
Ecommerce experience a plus

About Wayfair Inc.

Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.

Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related discipline.
3+ years of work experience with machine learning systems.
Proficiency in, at least, one modern programming and one modern scripting language such as C, C++, Java, Python, R
Familiarity with Amazon SageMaker
Proficiency with at least one modern ML framework such as PyTorch, Tensorflow, Keras
Strong Computer Science fundamentals in machine learning, data structures, algorithm design and complexity analysis.

Job summary

Are you excited about joining a team of scientists building lasting solutions for Amazon customers from the ground up? Our team is using data science, machine learning, and statistical methods to take Amazon’s unique customer obsession culture to another level by designing solutions that change customers behavior when it comes to product search, discovery, and purchase. In order to achieve this, we need scientists to build advanced algorithms that deliver first-rate user experience during customers’ shopping journeys on Amazon. These algorithms will utilize latest advances in Natural Language Understanding, and Computer Vision to source, understand, and vend contents that customers trust and find personally helpful regardless of the stage of the shopping journey they are at.

Key job responsibilities

As an Applied Scientist, you will:

Use statistical and machine learning techniques to create scalable and lasting systems.
Analyze and understand large amounts of Amazon’s historical business data for Recommender/Matching algorithms
Design, develop and evaluate highly innovative models for NLP.
Collaborate with other scientists and software engineers to drive science model implementations and new feature creation.
Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, validation, and implementation.
Research and implement novel machine learning and statistical approaches, particularly within the domains of NLP and Computer Vision

A day in the life
In this role, you’ll be utilizing your creative and critical problem-solving skills to drive new projects from ideation to implementation. Research, development, and implementation of ML models will be your where most of your time is spent.

About the team
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


A PhD in CS, Machine Learning, Statistics, Operations Research or in a highly quantitative field
1+ years of industry experience in predictive modeling and analysis
Superior ML breadth and depth
Expert skills with machine learning platforms such as PyTorch
Exceptional problem solver
Strong verbal and written communications skills; experience presenting complex technical information, succinctly, to technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project
Exceptional problem solving skills
