JobTitle: Sr. Principal Product Manager / Director of Product - AI and...
Content_text:
Join Axon and be a Force for Good.

At Axon, we're on a mission to Protect Life. We're explorers, pursuing society's most critical safety and justice issues with our ecosystem of devices and cloud software. Like our products, we work better together. We connect with candor and care, seeking out diverse perspectives from our customers, communities and each other.

Life at Axon is fast-paced, challenging and meaningful. Here, you'll take ownership and drive real change. Constantly grow as you work hard for a mission that matters at a company where you matter.

We are an equal opportunity employer that promotes justice, advances equity, values diversity and fosters inclusion. We're committed to hiring the best talent — regardless of race, creed, color, ancestry, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, genetic information, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances — and empowering all of our employees so they can do their best work. If you have a disability or special need that requires assistance or accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please email recruitingops@axon.com. Please note that this email address is for accommodation purposes only. Axon will not respond to inquiries for other purposes.

Your Impact

In this exciting role, you'll own and drive Axon's AI products and lead our machine learning efforts while working with research scientists & engineers as well as partners from across our organization to set compelling roadmaps and deliver scalable AI-enabled solutions. This will require you and your team to use state-of-the-art ML modeling, data and infrastructure techniques to not only build highly performant AI models but also to help educate internal and external stakeholders on the best ways to leverage the power of AI ethically and responsibly.

The ideal candidate is willing to be fearless and more than willing to take on bold challenges. You thrive in entrepreneurial environments while remaining calm and resourceful in the face of ambiguities and competing priorities. You are not only able to develop and drive high-level strategic initiatives, but can also dive deep in the details and deliver results. You are adept at seeing around corners to anticipate bottlenecks, making well-informed trade offs while balancing business needs versus technical constraints. You are able to influence with your high judgment, negotiation skills and analytical reasoning.

By building great products and accelerating the adoption of our technologies, you'll help protect life in public safety for both officers and the communities they serve around the world.
Your Day-to-Day
Drive the vision, strategy, and execution of Axon AI modeling efforts & product portfolio across multiple business pillars
Listen to Customers and foster strong connections across AI, Product and Business teams to better align team vision & roadmap with Customer expectations
Breakdown large, complex projects into manageable pieces, develop functional specifications, then deliver them in a successful and timely manner
Stay current with Machine Learning science & infrastructure trends to identify critical technology intersections where the time needs to invest
Conduct periodic product reviews with Axon's independent AI Ethics Board
Identify and evaluate strategic external partners for Axon AI to join forces with to deliver on our roadmap
Clearly communicate vision, plans, and results to partner teams, executives, and other stakeholders
Provide coaching and guidance to junior staff members, participate in devising career development plans and talent reviews.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics or an equivalent highly technical field
5-7 years of hands-on product management experience in a software development organization that builds large-scale distributed systems using a Customer-centric, working backward, metrics driven, iterative product development approach
3+ years of experience delivering multiple AI-enabled products from defining the vision and strategy to leading execution by working closely with science and engineering teams
Excellent verbal and written communication skills backed by a strong business acumen and technical vision
Adept at elaborating user scenarios, developing product specifications and devising proof of concept prototypes
Ability to understand complex technical/architectural trade offs and articulate impact on overall product performance and business implications while tailoring the message to various audience groups (e.g. engineers, researchers, executives)
Possesses practical knowledge of the machine learning life cycle and associated trade offs.
Able to make sound decisions related to modeling approaches, ethical considerations, data collection requirements, annotation needs and post deployment continuous learning
Preferred Qualifications
Master's or P.h.D. Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics or an equivalent highly technical field
Demonstrated knowledge and experience with machine learning platforms and deploying models at scale in cloud environments (such as AWS, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud)
Prior machine learning and deep learning experience as a researcher, engineer, or manager
Ability to script in Python and use data science tools like Spark is a plus
Familiarity with IoT/Edge AI and implications of running ML models on-device with constrained compute, power and latency budgets


Compensation and Benefits:

Competitive salary and 401K with employer match
Discretionary paid time off
Robust parental leave policy
An award-winning office/working environment
Ride along with police officers to see them use our technology and get inspired
And more...

NOTE: The above job description is not intended as, nor should it be construed as, exhaustive of all duties, responsibilities, skills, efforts, or working conditions associated with this job. The job description may change or be supplemented at any time in accordance with business needs and conditions.

Some roles may also require legal eligibility to work in a firearms environment.

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Operations
Job Details
Are you passionate about enabling Tableau internal customers and partners to get the most from their Big Data, Data Platform, Analytics, or Intelligence (AI) solutions? Do you enjoy collaborating across business units to find ways to realize the value of data? Do you love seeing data drive business decisions? Tableau’s Office of the CDO is seeking an experienced Sr. Director of Ai & Analytics. The candidate should have an extensive background in Analytics, Data Science/Machine Learning, Models, Data Platforms, Data Warehousing, Data Services, service-oriented architecture principles and business practices. This position will report to the Tableau Chief Data Officer, and will be driving greenfield strategy for a Ai & Analytics organization that will focus on powering Tableau with data by design eventing, data-driven business strategy and best in class Data Science practices. The leader will be a trusted advisor for our business partners, and work closely with the leaders within the Tableau Data and Analytics (TabDnA) team. This role is critical for a trust Data-First culture, and a focus on the value of data.
Role Description
The Business Intelligence Lead will initially operate as an IC, establishing the relationships, strategy, opportunity and low-hanging fruit for the new CDO function. The leader will partner heavily with the Data Science, Data Platform & Engineering, Architecture and Data Governance leaders to support Tableau business needs and improve visibility into the CDO office impact. This leader will create the framework for programs that will grow the business, understand usage patterns, improve product experience, Go-To-Market (GTM) plans and ensure the realization of operational efficiency that supports the company strategy and priorities.
Responsibilities:
Define CDO Ai & Analytics function strategy, opportunity, roadmap and priorities
Create Ai strategy and technology footprint
Understand current state business strategies and nextGen strategy direction
Understand the capabilities and value propositions of the current product portfolio and roadmap and the resulting Industry opportunities, challenges, and business concerns.
Develop scenario-based business value propositions and differentiated offers that incorporate content and story architectures based on industry and business experience
Work with the Data Platform & Services, Telemetry and internal business teams to strategize, envision, and plan Ai & Analytics solutions and offerings that align and support Tableau & Salesforce business strategy
Communicate Tableau AI & Analytics Value Proposition as it aligns to the scenario.
Engage deeply with the sales to modernize Field reporting and drive Tableau Literacy
Research industry challenges and opportunities to understand market trends, competitive forces, and Tableau/Salesforce product differentiation to inform the scenarios
Collaborate with sales, marketing, finance and other v-teams to land the overall GTM strategy that supports all the sales stages, demand generation through deal closure.
Harvest existing Tableau IP to support scenarios, identify IP gaps, and develop required IP to rollout GTM solutions.
Qualifications:
Desired Knowledge and Experience:
6+ years of Program or Product Management
Experience in marketing, communications, messaging, data synthesis, and storytelling.
Experience with AI and the data estate requirements to power advanced analytics models, the current opportunities, and challenges in this space as well as the competitive landscape around AI.
Business consulting experience is highly desired.
Experience in Technology is mandatory.
Strong user behavior design led thinking, business process and architecture acumen.
Strong business acumen with the ability to translate business challenges with corresponding solution approaches into technical requirements
Strong analytical skills, a passion for analytics technology, and creativity in defining how new technologies can help customers reduce costs, improve profitability, gain efficiency, and gain a competitive advantage and the ability to translate business challenges with corresponding solution approaches into rationalized GTMs
Experience building Usage, Sales or Delivery offerings
Demonstrated ability to learn fast in a dynamic environment.
Ability to communicate with senior executives, customers and partners effectively and professionally.
Adaptable work-style - functioning well both as a member of the team and as a self-directed, independent worker.
An undergraduate degree in Business or Information Systems, or equivalent experience. An MBA will be a key differentiator.
Ability to influence the business and engineering teams, on both short term and long term needs
Accommodations
If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .
Posting Statement

JobTitle: Sr. Marketing Campaign Manager, Global Campaigns, Machine Le...
Content_text:
7+ years of relevant work experience in demand generation for technology products or services, SaaS or Software experience preferred.
3+ years experience with campaign development including email marketing, lead nurturing, marketing automation, and marketing analytics.
Experience with campaign reporting, data analysis, and budget management.
Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, technology, or relevant field of study

Job summary
Experienced, self-directed Senior Campaign Manager and leader sought to drive strategy and development for Amazon Web Services (AWS) Global Campaigns for AWS Machine Learning Services.

The Senior Campaign Manager is responsible for the strategy, development, execution, reporting and optimization of global campaigns, working with internal stakeholders, including Product Marketing, Field Marketing, Brand Marketing, Executive Programs, as well as external agencies and third-party content developers and publications.

The ideal candidate will be able to manage multiple programs at one time, and will have a proven track record executing integrated lead generation campaigns that drive demand, acquire new leads, increase product adoption, and expand awareness of AWS solutions.

Strong preference for this position to be in San Francisco, CA or Seattle, WA, or near any Amazon/AWS U.S. Corp office. Relocation offered from within the US to these locations.

Key job responsibilities

Lead the strategy, development, and optimization of integrated campaigns, focused on key AWS priority solution themes and topics that are designed to generate leads for AWS Sales teams globally.
Work across a dynamic ecosystem of stakeholders to define, develop, and implement integrated campaign strategies.
Create optimized programs to generate leads and adoptions at scale across a number of audience segments.
Utilize customer buyer’s journey to architect innovative multi-channel engagement programs.
Orchestrate campaign and content development across a network of contributors and stakeholders.
Develop rich, bar-raising content designed to shift perception and acquire net-new marketable contacts.
Manage program budget with accountability for campaign return on investment (ROI).
Partner with external agencies in support of campaign asset creation and execution.
Dive deep into data with reports and dashboards in Tableau and Adobe Analytics to provide visibility into marketing campaign results, measure campaign effectiveness, and drive strategic decision making focused on campaign optimization.
Clear, consistent, and frequent communication with stakeholder teams to outline strategy, tactics, goals, and performance for campaigns.
Travel Required: Post-COVID 15%, including occasional international.

A day in the life
During campaign development you will work collaboratively with key stakeholders and partners, including Product Marketing, Field Marketing, Brand Marketing, and agencies, developing campaign strategy and supporting content. You will then work in close collaboration with Digital Marketing, Field Marketing, and Paid Media teams to activate and launch the campaign. Post launch, you will track campaign results and report campaign performance on a weekly and monthly basis to key stakeholders. You will highlight performance against goals, identify risks, challenges, and areas of opportunity, as well as campaign optimizations to be implemented based on insights garnered from data.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.
Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Proven understanding of the technology cycle and how to implement strategies to generate and nurture leads, drive interest, and accelerate the purchase process.
Understanding of a marketing funnel and how to align campaign strategies with customer journeys.
Analytical with a curiosity to measure, test, learn, and iterate in order to deliver the best possible results.
Experience utilizing systems and tools involving email, web, analytics, and CRM (Marketo, Tableau, Salesforce, etc.) for targeting, segmentation, reporting for demand generation and adoption campaigns.
Experience with paid media, preferably display and programmatic advertising, content syndication, social media, and search.
Experience developing creative and managing agency partners.
Experience working in a collaborative environment, with the ability to build relationships with key stakeholders – product marketing, field marketing, and sales teams.
Ability to thrive in a self-service environment.
Superior oral and written communication skills with an innate attention to detail.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Device & Supply Chain is an enterprise function accountable for the end-to-end life-cycle of T-Mobile’s consumer-facing hardware portfolio (phones, chipsets, accessories, IoT), device services portfolio (insurance, warranty, trade-ins, and financing), and supply chain operations (distribution centers, logistics, inventory, etc.).

This team also oversees the services we offer for device financing, mobile banking, and managing the millions of phones that get returned each year from our device services like remorse, trade-ins, lease returns, and JUMP!.
Device Strategy team is building device portfolio and roadmap that fuel enterprise growth for T-Mobile with direct accountability for making the optimal decisions to drive subscriber growth, improve device costs, accelerate technology innovations, improve the impact on supply chain operations, and capitalize on insights from customers device purchase to help New T-Mobile achieve financial and growth targets. Team is also responsible for delivering structural, operational, financial insights to drive success in supply chain operations, strategic supply chain initiatives, partnerships, and inventory management.

At T-Mobile, we strongly encourage everyone, including people of color, veterans, military spouses, individuals with disabilities, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, and parents to apply. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome everyone to our team. If you are an individual with a disability and need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know by emailing ApplicantAccommodation@t-mobile.com or calling +91-XXXXXXXXXX. Please note, this contact channel is not a means to apply for or inquire about a position and we are unable to respond to non-accommodation related requests.
At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States
High School Diploma or GED
T-Mobile requires all employees in this position to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 prior to starting work. The CDC defines "fully vaccinated" as two weeks after the second dose for Pfizer and Moderna, and two weeks after the single dose of Johnson & Johnson. T-Mobile will require proof of vaccination and consider requests for exemption from this requirement during the offer phase as a reasonable accommodation for medical reasons or sincerely held religious beliefs where the accommodation would not cause T-Mobile undue hardship or pose a direct threat to the health and safety of others.
The expanded role requires designing and operating analytical frameworks and financial models to guide executive decisions in highly complex business problems. With Sprint merger, the complexity of the business models that New T-Mobile device portfolio needs to support and analyze are further expanded.
With Sprint merger, New T-Mobile’s portfolio needs expands with new customer profiles (different consumer subscriber bases, business lines, education, government accounts) and device products beyond smartphones (Project 10M, IoT, tablets, trackers, data devices).
With expanded customer segments and new business models, the role requires a skill set and demonstrated experience for framing unstructured and complex analytical problems and convert them to actionable device portfolio decisions.
In the technology space, we need to further expand our analyses in projecting migration and penetration of various network technologies. The role requires an understanding of network economics and customer experience trade-offs given network technologies. Also, the previous customer device purchase behaviors need to be analyzed with data science tools and converted to future sales projections.
Data analysis and modeling skills on tools like Excel, Alteryx, and SQL need to be at the advanced level. The models need to be highly auditable, replicable, and transferable. Comfortable extracting and manipulating large datasets with SQL. Preferred experience in data analysis tools and mathematical programming tools like Python, MATLAB, Alteryx, Tableau, and GIS systems
The role requires excellent communication skills, ability to present analytical results to executives in verbal and written form and ability to influence senior leaders, peers, and other organization members. Deep expertise in creating executive level presentations in MS PPT
Demonstrated knowledge and experience on wireless network and device technologies, relevant experience in one or more of the following (or related) industries: technology, supply chain, retail, mobile devices, subscription services
Experience in business analysis for growth initiatives in customer segments beyond consumer including B2B, education, government
Experience in one or more of the following roles: management consultancy with analytics, corporate strategy and analytics, subscriber analysis, technology penetration analysis, product analysis
Preferred understanding and experience in consumer behavior and research particularly in technology context
Demonstrated excellent skills in one or more of the following areas: data analysis/visualization, financial modeling, forecasting, and statistical modeling, mathematical/computer programming
Bachelors Degree in a quantitative discipline, preferably Industrial Engineering or Statistics, and Masters/PhD Degree in Operations Research, Operations Management, Industrial Engineering, Finance or MBA preferred
Flexible, self-starter, and comfortable working in a rapidly changing environment
Desire for a high level of responsibility and ownership and ability to work with minimal supervision
Desire to work in a team-oriented environment
Okay. You've seen what we're looking for and you're up to the challenge. Here's what we can offer you in exchange for your outstanding work:
Competitive base pay plus annual bonus potential
Benefits for part-time and full-time associates
Medical, dental and vision benefits
Matching 401(k)
An annual Employee Stock Grant, and a purchase plan that gives you the chance to grab TMUS stock at a discount
Generous paid time-off programs
Phone service discounts
Education reimbursement
Serious growth potential for your career!
This is the opportunity to do something special and be part of a company revolutionizing the wireless industry. And we couldn’t do it without someone like you. So, what do you say? Isn’t it time you explored what could become the career move of a lifetime? We invite you to apply today!
Construct and operate strategic and analytical frameworks to guide device selection, sourcing, portfolio management, and device lifecycle decisions
Design and operate operational and analytical frameworks and financial models to guide executive decisions for strategic supply chain initiatives, partnerships, supply chain operations, and inventory management
Evaluate device portfolio needs, perform customer segmentation, and analysis for a broad variety of line of businesses and customer segments including consumer, business, education, government
Develop strategies for device products beyond smartphones such as IoT, tablets, trackers, data devices through customer segmentation, growth analysis, and financial modeling
Perform device and technology penetration analysis and advice on network technology components on our device portfolio to ensure efficient use of New T-Mobile network and spectrum assets and achieve merger synergies
Explore and synthesize insights from technology, industry, and competitive research
Work with key enterprise stakeholders including marketing, technology, sales, and customer care to develop short- and long-term device and supply chain strategy, provide key analysis, and advise on opportunities and threats identified through strategic thinking, data analysis, research
Structure complex business models to provide analytics and guidance to OEM and supply chain partner negotiations
Create and deliver executive level presentations and dashboards on strategy, insights, and execution to senior management and partner organizations
Equal Employment Opportunity

We take equal opportunity seriously—by choice.

T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship will be made without regard to age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, religious affiliation, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Discrimination, retaliation or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with how we do business and will not be tolerated.

Description:
Providence is calling a Principal Technical Product Manager to one of our locations in Washington, Alaska, Oregon, Montana, California, New Mexico, or Texas.
Providence is one of the largest not-for-profit health systems in the United States.
At Providence, we use our voice to advocate for vulnerable populations and health care reforms. We pursue innovative ways to transform health care by keeping people healthy, and making our services more convenient, accessible and affordable for all. In an increasingly uncertain world, we are committed to high-quality, compassionate health care for everyone—regardless of coverage or ability to pay. We help people and communities benefit from the best health care model for the future, today.
The Digital Innovation Group (DIG) at Providence is a small but mighty product development and incubation team. We build next-gen tools that give patients convenient and easy access to health care anywhere, anytime.
DIG is both a healthcare startup and a technology/product incubator. Our team gathers market data on effective solutions in the health care space and then builds out a product line with the latest and greatest technology. When market maturity hits, DIG enables the product to spin out as its own company. It is a unique mix of venture capitalists, digital strategists, marketing acumen, product development and engineering all in one group nestled inside one of the largest health systems. We set the pace for other health care organizations on how to conceive, engineer and launch effective health care solutions. Recently funded DIG startups include DexCare and Xealth.
We require your expertise and passion to bring our next set of products to life. We are currently in the initial stages of incubating ideas related to virtual health assistants including triage, symptom pursuit and care navigation using ML and NLP. Additionally, we are pursuing personalized digital engagement for wellness. Success means you will have the opportunity to join future startups on the ground floor.
This is a remote work opportunity in the US with occasional travel expected to Vancouver BC or Seattle WA.
Summary:
We are seeking a Principal Technical Product Manager who will be a vital leadership role for the Digital Innovation Group at Providence and reports to senior director of product development. Key goals and accountabilities are:
Understand complex customer problems and how these can be translated into solutions.
Use your data-driven, business-informed mindset to define and deliver the product with a high degree of complexity that have broad cross-organizational impact.
Make appropriate tradeoffs between customer goals and the product experience
Clearly communicate product’s long-term vision, goals, and product strategy to drive alignment across the team and other stakeholders.
Possess a strong program management background, experience leading medium to large projects, and a well-rounded technical background in modern software development such as web, mobile, distributed systems, and machine learning.
Thrive and succeed in an entrepreneurial environment, and not be hindered by ambiguity or competing priorities.
In this position you will have the following responsibilities:
Drive product definition, strategy, and long-term vision for healthcare smart assistant product vertical.
Identify the biggest problems and drive new feature development from start to finish.
Run user research, usability studies, data-driven experiments to inform product direction.
Build, measure, and iterate rapidly.
Consistently integrate behavior data and customer feedback into key product decisions.
Communicate product plans, benefits and results to all audiences - within teams, company, to users, press etc.
Build deep relationships with executives and stakeholders across organizations to advocate for and maximize the value of the products you own.
Qualifications:
Required qualifications for this position include:
BS in one of the following disciplines: Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, or other related scientific or engineering fields.
6 years in Product Management at a technology company, ideally working on products with ML/AI at its core.
Experience building cross-platform experiences (native, mobile web, desktop).
Experience delivering impactful products and features that are heavily informed by data as well as user research.
Demonstrated ability to solve complex problems by crafting customer-first solutions and thinking from first principles.
Strong data driven problem solving skills.
Experience influencing the Executive Team members on key strategy and cross-functional initiatives.
Preferred qualifications for this position include:
Master’s degree in one of these disciplines is preferred.
Healthcare experience is a plus.
10 years experience in software industry
About the department you will serve.
Providence Shared Services provides a variety of functional and system support services for our Providence family of organizations across Alaska, California, Montana, New Mexico, Oregon, Texas and Washington. We are focused on supporting our Mission by delivering a robust foundation of services and sharing of specialized expertise.
We offer comprehensive, best-in-class benefits to our caregivers. For more information, visit
https://www.providenceiscalling.jobs/rewards-benefits/
Our Mission
As expressions of God’s healing love, witnessed through the ministry of Jesus, we are steadfast in serving all, especially those who are poor and vulnerable.
About Us
Providence is a comprehensive not-for-profit network of hospitals, care centers, health plans, physicians, clinics, home health care and services continuing a more than 100-year tradition of serving the poor and vulnerable. Providence is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Providence does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, disability, veteran, military status, religion, age, creed, national origin, sexual identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, or any other basis prohibited by local, state, or federal law.

Shift: Day
Job Category: Non-Clinical Lead/Supervisor/Manager
Location: Washington-Seattle
Other Location(s): Montana, Oregon-Portland, California, New Mexico, Oregon, Washington-Redmond, Washington, Texas, Alaska, California-Irvine

JobTitle: Senior Applied Scientist, Supply Chain Optimization Technolo...
Content_text:
PhD in machine learning, operations research, applied mathematics or a related field.
5+ years of experience building machine learning models for business applications.
Expert knowledge in at least one of following fields: machine learning, natural language processing.
Fluency in a high-level modeling language such as R, Python, Matlab or other statistical software.
Experience with one object oriented programming language such as Java or C++.
Ability to convey scientific and mathematical concepts and considerations to business and product teams.

Job summary
Do you want to decide what is sold on Amazon WW? Amazon is looking for an outstanding senior applied scientist to help build next generation selection and assortment systems. You will apply machine learning, optimization, and big data to figure out what products customer want and how to offer it on Amazon. Your work to improve Amazon's product selection will delight customers and drive the flywheel.

Key job responsibilities

Responsibilities:

Research and implement machine learning models to solve problems that matter to our customers.
Understand business requirements and existing challenges and map them to the right scientific solution.
Own end-to-end solution in terms of research, prototyping, experimentation to launch.
Develop the right set of metrics to evaluate efficiency/accuracy of the algorithms.
Mentor and develop the scientist community across the organization.

We created a short video to introduce Supply Chain Optimization at Amazon - http://bit.ly/amazon-scot

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

A day in the life

Apply machine learning and optimization models to develop large-scale systems that are deployed across the company.
Define the scientific vision and roadmap for the team. Identify business opportunities, define the problem and plan to solve it.
Leads the project plan from a scientific perspective on product launches including identifying potential risks, key milestones, and paths to mitigate risks.
Review and audits modeling processes and results for other scientists, both junior and senior.

About the team
The Core Selection Team within the Supply Chain Optimization Technologies (SCOT) organization, determines what products are sold on Amazon WW. We build algorithms and systems to figure out what products customers want and how to offer it on Amazon. You will join a fast-paced team of scientists, engineers, economists, and product managers.

More info on the SCOT org:
https://www.amazon.jobs/en/teams/scot


Experience in feature engineering and building advanced forecasting models.
Familiarity/experience with retail industry and the assortment planning space.

LOCATION: Seattle, Washington
Welcome to Holland America Line, a premium cruise line dedicated to explorers, foodies and music lovers who want to explore the world on perfectly sized, refreshingly spacious ships filled with one-of-a-kind experiences.
We’re looking for an amazing marketing professional with a customer/market research background to fill this role, which is based in our Seattle office. You’ll be responsible for supporting a variety of primary and secondary research projects targeting consumers and travel advisors in order to help enhance our marketing programs and overall guest experience. This role will work with business stakeholders to understand learning needs and design a research agenda to build our knowledge and will work with cross-functional partners to develop and administer surveys. This is an excellent opportunity for a research professional who can work both independently and collaboratively and can translate research data into actionable insights to support our company’s success.
Here’s a summary of what Holland America Line is looking for in its Consumer Insights Analyst . Is this you?
Responsibilities
Work with Marketing team leads and executive stakeholders to help define research purpose (what problem are we trying to solve) and what approach (e.g. what kind of questions; methodology) to take to gather the most useful insights.
Develop methodology, collaborate with internal and external resources to create and administer surveys or other forms of research.
Create presentations with clear and concise research findings that include actionable, data-driven insights.
Presentation design approach should enhance the story telling, focusing on flow, headlines, and visualization.
Present those insights to marketing leadership and executive stakeholders.
Maintain and administer a schedule of routine tracking surveys while also managing ad-hoc requests.
Determine and quantify primary business opportunities and key drivers by analyzing data.
Collaborate with sister-brand research teams on research best practices, ways to design surveys to address potential needs of multiple brands, and share project support for select tracking.
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Data Science, Statistics, and/or Business.
3-5 years’ experience in customer/market research.
Proven experience administering surveys with online survey tools, ideally Qualtrics.
Knowledgeable in non-survey research methods including focus groups, secondary research. Experience working with external vendors to deliver non-survey research projects.
Fluent understanding of customer segmentation and personalization.
Proactive problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
Intellectually curious and committed to continuous learning.
Creative, able to fill in gaps in data to generate new hypotheses for research.
Ability to distill analysis into concise recommendations and present to management audiences up to the executive level.
Proven excellent communication skills – written and verbal.
Highly proficient with the Microsoft Office Suite: Excel, Word, PowerPoint.
Experience in the Travel and Leisure industry.
Capable of and enjoys coaching others to use leverage research insights.
Experience with Customer Relationship Management and Web Analytics tools and data.
Pluses
Master’s Degree in Marketing, Data Science, Statistics, and/or Business.
Experience with a research firm or in research and/or analytics within a brand marketing or strategic planning team.
Benefits
Cruise and Travel Privileges for You and Your family
Health Benefits
401(k)
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Training & Professional Development
Rewards & Incentives

Our highest responsibility and top priority is compliance, environmental protection and the health, safety and well-being of our guests, the people in the communities we touch and serve, and our shipboard and shoreside employees.
