Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .
Salesforce welcomes all.
As a federal contractor, Salesforce is required to verify that all US-based employees are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If you receive an offer and are unable to get vaccinated for religious or medical reasons, you may request a reasonable accommodation.

Microsoft Store is the public face of Microsoft, where every individual, community and business can directly experience all that's possible with Microsoft, and we’re looking for the best and brightest talent to tell our story. Are you interested in a career where you can inspire customers and make an impact while building lifelong skills? If so, we’re the place for you! Help connect customers with their passions to achieve more, through our physical and digital retail properties. Microsoft Store includes jobs in physical retail locations, digital property teams and corporate locations.
Microsoft Store’s vision is to help our customers discover everything that’s possible with Microsoft. To deliver on this vision we are building the digital shopping destinations across Web, Xbox console and Windows PC where our customers can experience the best in Gaming, Productivity and Entertainment from Microsoft, and become a part of global community.
Responsibilities
In this role, you will be responsible for leading business analysts, supporting Digital Stores at Microsoft, covering a wide range of analytics (Web analytics, ecommerce analytics, marketing analytics, customer behavior analysis & in-product analytics, etc.). You will be accountable for the intake and prioritization process for analytical needs, be the “voice” of analytics in stakeholder forums; up-level data-informed storytelling across Microsoft Store, partnering with multiple teams across data science, engineering and marketing organizations. You will also serve as a business DRI for delivery of committed analytics-related priorities.
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Manage, coach and mentor a team of Business Analysts to formulate, design and create analytical projects
Partner with stakeholders to deeply understand the business problems and drive application of analytics techniques to support solutioning
Support analytics design decisions by taking relevant inputs from business team and defining clear plan for analytics team; pushes analytics teams to confirm assumptions, extract relevant insights and to interpret the models and outputs
Lead communication of analytics outputs with stakeholders; acts as bridge between management and analytics specialists; Shares insights with business stakeholders and collects input
Work collaboratively with data engineering teams as required to acquire all necessary data to support project needs (data exploration, training data, feature engineering, modeling, etc.….)
Continuously learn about the industry trends and keep the key stakeholders educated
Lead and develop an awesome team of Microsoft Store Analysts, retain and attract great talent
Qualifications
Minimum 7+ years of relevant experience in data analytics – covering topics such as web store analytics, ecommerce analytics, marketing analytics, in-product analytics, customer behavior analysis, forecasting, sales performance analysis, gaming analytics & telemetry fundamentals
Experience leading a high-performing team of analysts
Understanding of data exploration techniques, storytelling with data and statistical software packages
Excellent problem solving, planning and execution skills
Methodical, detail oriented with experience diving deep and asking the right questions
Ability to understand and discuss analysis, distill them for a broader audience, and clearly articulate key insights to leadership, supported by a strong understand
Strong willingness to learn new hard and soft skills, and develop new professional capability
Strong communicator with experience in working with senior management
Excellent problem-solving skills
Post-graduate degree desirable
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Who We Are:

NanoString Technologies (NASDAQ: NSTG) is a leading provider of life science tools for discovery and translational research. The company's nCounter® Analysis System is used in life sciences research and has been cited in more than 3,800 peer-reviewed publications. The nCounter Analysis System offers a cost-effective way to easily profile the expression of hundreds of genes, proteins, miRNAs, or copy number variations, simultaneously with high sensitivity and precision, facilitating a wide variety of basic research and translational medicine applications. The company's GeoMx® Digital Spatial Profiler enables highly-multiplexed spatial profiling of RNA and protein targets in a variety of sample types, including FFPE tissue sections. Built on pioneering principles in 2003, NanoString is blazing new trails and exploring new frontiers to adapt to the everchanging landscape and becoming smarter and more innovative in the process. We are dedicated to advancing scientific discovery and providing solutions that can have a meaningful impact in research and discovery.

Our purpose is to Map the Universe of Biology. We enable scientists to answer questions they have always wanted to ask to explore the boundaries of cellular structures and create an atlas of biological interactions that define life. We are relentless in our quest to Catalyze the Next Biological Revolution leading to Advancing the Human Condition. In addition to a pioneering spirit, we value: Grit. Authenticity. Ambition. Ingenuity. Customers. Join our team!


Job Summary:

NanoString is seeking an energetic and highly motivated Data Scientist I, Computational Biology to join the Translational Science team within Research and Development. This team member will be responsible for supporting the data analysis services (DAS) for the GeoMx Digital Spatial Profiler platform and future spatial biology platforms at NanoString by developing and maintaining analysis pipelines and creating fit-for-purpose solutions to bespoke customer projects. This role will work closely with the commercial and R&D teams to manage customer interactions and ensure timely resolution to unique customer data analysis challenges, while ensuring data and analytical code integrity.


Essential Responsibilities:

This individual is expected to serve as a key developer for new analytical pipelines and tools for use with spatial analysis platforms developed for use with the DAS program. The individual will work on cutting-edge projects that extend the capabilities within the DAS program, and will be responsible for maintaining code bases associated with the program. The work is highly cross-functional and will require coordinating with NanoString research scientists, biostatisticians, software developers, and customer experience personnel.


Develop and maintain novel pipelines for analysis of high-plex spatial data
Design and execute move analytical workflows for customer spatial 'omics profiling datasets
Work directly with internal and external customers to address data analysis challenges, managing project life cycle from intake through result return
Provide escalation-level support and education for data analysis issues
Interpret and present results within the context of the biological question and implications for a given project
Present results to technical and non-technical audiences; participate in scientific discussions
Maintain well annotated code and detailed records of analyses


Qualifications:

This role requires a background in biological interpretation of high-plex molecular data, skills in computation, algorithm development or application, and a history of engagement within the scientific community. The ideal candidate will have an understanding of agile software development best practices, and a commitment to supporting a community of researchers within and outside of NanoString.

Ph.D. with 0-3+ years industry/post-doctoral experience or MS with 3+ years' experience with background in Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Biostatistics, Genomics, or related field
Experience analyzing multi-omics datasets such as transcriptomics or proteomics with standard biostatistical methodologies and bioinformatics software tools
Proficiency in R required, other scripting languages preferred
Experience with code versioning best practices and tools, such as git
Familiarity with scrum/agile development best practices
Domain knowledge within a relevant biological area (oncology, immunology, etc) required; advanced knowledge preferred
Excellent organizational skills, and good time management practices; ability to communicate timelines and meet deadlines
Ability to work both independently and as member of a project team
Analytical and creative problem-solving skills
Ability to listen and understand customer questions, issues, and concerns, both technical and operational
Strong communication skills; ability to summarize scientific data for an expert and non-expert audience
NanoString is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. NanoString does not accept unsolicited agency resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that it does not have a signed agreement with.

COVID-19 VACCINATION REQUIREMENT: NanoString has a COVID-19 vaccination policy that applies to ALL U.S. employees (regardless of work location), onsite contractors and visitors except as prohibited by applicable law. As a condition of employment, newly hired employees are required to provide proof of full vaccination within 31 days of their hiring date or have applied for an exemption for which an accommodation can be made. Being fully vaccinated means that an individual is at least two weeks past their final (or only) dose of an authorized COVID-19 vaccine regimen. Exemptions will be considered for medical conditions/disabilities and sincerely held religious beliefs, observations, or practices. For any visitor coming onsite to one of NanoString's facilities, we must verify that the visitor is fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to site entry and visitors must don a face mask at all times when onsite in a NanoString facility.

Accommodations

If you require assistance or accommodation when applying for open positions please contact recruiting@nanostring.com.

What We Need:

The Senior Data Analyst will be the project and business lead for some of our global client list, collaborating with agency partners and Insight & Analytics team members. You will serve as a trusted advisor to clients and account partners, helping them strategize and measure impact against the social, web, search, and PR/Communication objectives. In addition, you will work with Insight & Analytics teammates to set expectations, delegate work, and meet deadlines. If you are an expert in analytics, love to dig into ‘the why’ and can express your findings in ways that are quick and easy to understand then we are looking for you.
What you'll be doing:
Multi-Channel Analysis: looking across, social, online news, forums, paid media, digital video, podcasts, and web analytics to uncover insights related to the conversation connected to our clients and their competition and how influencers, audiences, and content impact the discussion.
Trusted Advisor: Business and Project Lead for a set of clients in our global client list.
Project management: You will lead small to large projects and will need to run them effectively, on time and on budget, in partnership with the I&A team.
Data Storytelling: deliver high quality, integrated communications, highlighting analytic capabilities to illuminate actionable insights for communications, marketing and social media campaigns aligned to client business goals and objectives. You are a partner to both internal stakeholders and clients to develop the data strategy.
Data visualization: showcase your expertise and ability to translate data from multiple data sources into a compelling story.
What you've been able to accomplish:
Bachelor’s degree in marketing/communications (Strategic Communications, Marketing Communications, Market Research, or a quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Data Science), or the equivalent combination of education and experience.
2-4+ years of Client and project management with advanced organizational and project management skills.
5+ years of data analysis, data visualization, and/or market research experience is required.
Demonstrated experience in the following types of research projects – social media, website analytics, search analytics, brand reputation, executive platforms, audience development, thought leadership, influencer identification, crisis management and measurement and optimization.
Demonstrated experience in quantitative research in the following areas – industry, competitive, audience and influencer analysis.
Proficient with Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI.
Has passion and ability to learn new technologies, tools, and platforms. Experience with social analytics platforms such as Talkwalker, Audiense, Meltwater, Netbase, Sprinklr or similar platforms is a plus.
Self-motivated and able to adapt quickly to changing priorities and tight deadlines.
Experience working remotely or with colleagues in multiple locations.
Must be able to work more than 40 hours per week on occasion.
About Us:

WE Communications:
WE is one of the largest communications and integrated marketing agencies in the world. We’re independent, we’re all about our people — both our clients and our employees — and we believe in the power of communications to move audiences to positive action.
For more than 30 years, we have been helping translate complex innovations into powerful, persuasive stories. Our sector expertise across key verticals — including technology, healthcare, consumer, and brand purpose — translates into insights and strategies that are informed, current and credible.
We work with companies that are embracing the ever-evolving digital world to reinvent themselves, to deliver new value to their customers or reach them in new ways and ultimately improve people’s lives.
#LI-KK1
#LI-Hybrid
Equal Opportunity: WE provides equal employment opportunity and does not discriminate against an employee or applicant because of age, race, color, religion, gender, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, or other legally protected class status.
Diversity and Inclusion: WE values a diverse and inclusive workforce and is committed to creating a workplace where everyone thrives. We promote an atmosphere in which diversity of people and ideas are welcomed and valued. Diversity includes differences in race, religion, gender identity or expression, age, lifestyle, ethnic background and sexual orientation as well as differences in experiences and ideas.

WORK LOCATION: A HYBRID WORK EXPERIENCE
At GroupM, we believe that work is a part of life, not the other way around. To support that belief, we have recently adopted a “collaboration-led” hybrid approach to work in order to provide employees with the flexibility to do the best work of their lives no matter where they are working. This means that for roles where it makes sense, you'll spend some of your time in our incredible workspaces (when it's safe to do so) and some of your time remote. Check out this updated list of where we can hire:
California – LA or SF
Colorado – Denver
Florida – Miami/Fort Lauderdale
Georgia – Atlanta
Illinois – Chicago
Massachusetts – Boston
Michigan – Detroit
New York – New York City tri-state area (NY, NJ, CT)
North Carolina – Raleigh/Durham
Texas – Austin or Dallas/Fort Worth
Utah – Salt Lake City
ABOUT US:
The GroupM Data & Analytics Services team combines ad-tech and mar-tech strategy with data science & data engineering expertise to make advertising work better for clients and consumers.

Collaborating with GroupM search, social and programmatic services teams, adtech and media partners, the DAS team deploys world class analytics solutions impacting $4B+ in US Media investment across our agencies - Catalyst, Essence, MediaCom, Mindshare and Wavemaker.
ABOUT THE ROLE:
We are looking for a talented Associate Director to join our leadership team and manage the delivery of data engineering projects for GroupM’s agencies and clients. In this role, you will be responsible to manage a team of highly skilled data engineers, scientists and analysts to deliver data-driven solutions to exceed client goals.
 As the Associate Director, Data and Analytics, you will work with the agency and client teams to enable the data and tech solutions that lay the foundation for executing brand & performance marketing.
YOUR IMPACT:
Support development and deployment of GroupM products and services across multiple cloud environments
Collaborate with a cross-functional team of client leads, application developers, operations engineers, and architects to translate complex product requirements into technical specs and design requirements
Optimize performance and cost efficiency of cloud based processes across multiple cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Maintain a high degree of knowledge in cloud data architecture and ETL best practices especially across Google Cloud Platform products and services
Act as a consultant and subject matter expert for internal stakeholders in GroupM Data & Analytics, GroupM Engineering and agency data science and tech leads
Develop and deploy automated scripts in BigQuery and other Google cloud services to be used by other teams to increase productivity
Facilitate architectural discussions and initiatives to ensure cloud-based products are optimally deployed with maximum availability of design features
Formulate and execute robust UAT protocols to identify and address latent errors in product functions
Design, build and deploy ETL and data management processes with reliable error/exception handling and rollback framework
Provide production support for data load jobs and develop customized query to generate automatic periodic reports
Build applications writing SQL/Python scripts to manipulate data and/or writing specific instructions for an off-shore programmers to write the scripts
YOUR QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or other technical field is highly preferred
Good written and verbal communication skills
Strong expertise with Data Architecture fundamentals, database design and programming, ETL and custom query development
Experience with the following GCP Services: Cloud Storage, DataProc, Dataflow, CloudSQL, BigQuery
Experience with building data pipes landing large files into Azure/GCP/AWS for processing, developing/ cleansing data for AI/ML purposes
Experience using the Linux Command Line
Experience with source code management systems
Use of Data Profiling Tools, ETL and Data Management Tools
Data warehousing/data modeling experience, with strong understanding of semantic and physical data models
Knowledge of Agile methodology
Able to deliver a broad range of data engagements in areas such as Data Architecture, Data Integration, Data Analytics, Data Governance, Data Quality and BI Reporting
Understanding of data analysis techniques and how they can be applied in the marketing context beneficial
Experience with the full development life cycle of an application stack - from architecture through test and deployment preferred
Prior knowledge of advertising ecosystem, understanding of marketing metrics, and analytical products offered as a service is preferred
ABOUT GROUPM:
At the heart of the world’s leading media agency network is a future-facing product company, building the tools to make media work for everyone. In partnership with the globe’s leading clients, agency teams, media companies and technology platforms, we’re using our privileged position to help our customers ascend to vantage points unique in our industry.
Our teams bring together agile product management, cutting edge data science and enterprise scale engineering to build products that will shape the next decade of data driven marketing. We believe consumer privacy, client confidentiality, brand growth and user experience are essential to performance and the sustainability of the advertising ecosystem and have assembled a global team with diverse skills and experience to help shape that future.
GroupM and all its affiliates embrace and celebrate diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide media agency network that represents global clients. The more inclusive we are, the more great work we can create together.

Technology enhances your life - your job should too. Microsoft Digital Store is the worldwide direct sales engine for Microsoft’s cutting-edge devices and services delivered directly to consumers, dual-users and businesses. We are here to provide our customers with a world-class, omni-channel purchase and support experience in this evolving retail world. We serve as centers of innovation, connecting customers with technology that simplifies their lives and inspires their creative potential.
The Digital Stores Analytics team is looking for an experienced Lead Data Scientist focused to support business areas within Microsoft Store’s organization. From day to day this role may involve collaborating with category managers, marketing managers, digital merchandisers, business analysts, engineers, and others to understand their business scenarios and support with analytics solutions. This role will contribute to data driven decision making in the organization through insights by driving Data Science projects in partnership with Business Analytics and Data Engineering teams.
Success in this role is defined as consistent and reliable execution of Data Science projects, with clear communication about priorities, status, and compliance, while aligning with key stakeholders.
Responsibilities
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Drive end to end execution of Data Science projects independently
Lead and guide junior data scientists and vendors to formulate, design and create analytical projects
Provide guidance to the team and vendors to successfully complete projects. Guidance may include – Scoping of business questions, setting up milestones, data mining, statistical models, customer segmentation, pricing analytics, causal inference models, marketing analytics, qualitative models, market research, econometric models, decision trees, classification models and presentation of insights
Partner with stakeholders to deeply understand the business problems and identify suitable analytics solutions
Support analytics design decisions by taking relevant inputs from business team and define clear plan for analytics team; confirm assumptions, interpret the models and outputs, and extract relevant insights
Lead communication of analytics outputs with stakeholders; acts as bridge between management and data scientists; Shares insights with business stakeholders through effective storytelling and collect feedback
Work collaboratively with data engineering teams as required to acquire all necessary data to support project needs (data exploration, training data, feature engineering, modeling, etc.)
Continuously learn about the industry trends and up level organizational knowledge in data science field
Qualifications
Minimum 5+ years of relevant experience being a data scientist
Understanding of data exploration techniques, analytics, statistical techniques & software packages, and storytelling with data
Experience working on Big Data and ML technologies – Azure ML, Cosmos/Hadoop, Databricks, R, Python, SQL, SAS, Teradata
Experience in statistical models, customer segmentation, pricing analytics, causal inference models, marketing analytics, qualitative models, market research, econometric models, decision trees, & classification models, etc.
Excellent problem solving, planning and execution skills.
Methodical, detail oriented with experience diving deep and asking the right questions
Strong willingness to learn new hard and soft skills, and develop new professional capability
Strong communicator with experience in working with senior management
Post-graduate degree desirable

Media Attribution is a team of leaders with vision and intellect. We are problem solvers who apply meticulous analytics to assess and steer T-Mobile’s enterprise paid media spend, driving growth through our media investments. We combine our ability to dive into the data with business acuity – we understand the drivers of performance through every stage of the funnel and guide leadership on key media investment decisions. Join us to ignite your intellectual curiosity to write the next chapter of the Un-carrier!
We are seeking a curious, forward-thinking, strategic problem solver with statistical aptitude and interpersonal talent to provide advanced analytical support to our team. A keen interest in media (TV, Digital, Social media, Paid Search), a business + scientific mentality, excellent communication skills, and an unwavering willingness to tackle complicated problems are all vital to success.

Master’s or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as engineering, operations research, mathematics, computer science, statistics, economics, or finance
3+ years demonstrated ability in an analytics, quantitative, or data science role; in a marketing or business setting highly preferred
3+ years of experience working on and coordinating analytical projects through the development lifecycle with internal and external partners

Okay. You’ve seen what we’re looking for and you’re up to the challenge. Here’s what we can offer you in exchange for your outstanding work:

JobTitle: newScientist I, Deep Learning and Computer Vision
CompanyLocation: Seattle, WA 98109 (South Lake Union area)+1 location•Temporarily Remote
Content_text:
Scientist I, Deep Learning and Computer Vision
The mission of the Allen Institute for Cell Science is to create multi-scale visual models of cell organization, dynamics, and activities. Our approach encompasses large scale data collection, observation, theory, and predictions to understand cellular behavior in normal and pathological contexts. As a division within the Allen Institute, the Allen Institute for Cell Science uses a team-oriented approach, focusing on accelerating foundational research, developing standards and models, and cultivating new ideas to make a transformational impact on science.
The Allen Institute for Cell Science uses 3D live cell imaging to generate unprecedented data for the analysis of the cell and its components as an integrated system. We seek a talented scientist to join the Computational Biology and Machine Learning Team to help build, analyze, and deploy sophisticated computational models of cell states and dynamic cellular processes that leverage these rich images and movies independently and in concert with diverse complementary data. Research at the Institute is highly collaborative, requiring scientists and engineers to work across disciplines, focusing on high impact biological questions and establishing/maintaining the highest standards for best practices and computational rigor.
The role of this position is to develop, implement and apply deep neural networks to identify and understand patterns in Institute-generated high content, live cell microscopy images and time-lapse movies. Examples of current machine learning projects in the team include: prediction of subcellular structures from transmitted light microscopy (see here), and building an integrated model of subcellular structure using a conditional generative model (see here).
The Allen Institute believes that team science significantly benefits from the participation of diverse voices, experiences, and backgrounds. High-quality science can only be produced when it includes different perspectives. We are committed to increasing diversity across every team and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for this role.
**Applicants should include a brief cover letter (max 1 Page) explaining why they are a good fit for this position.**
Essential Functions
Conceive, develop, and implement machine learning models to analyze live cell microscopy images and time-lapse videos
Train, parametrize, and evaluate machine learning models to investigate cellular organization and cellular state transitions
Promote integration and sharing of tools, resources, models, and data across the Institute
Work across teams as part of Institute-scale interdisciplinary scientific projects
Practice software development best practices and follow industry standards
Communicate effectively within and across teams, as well as with the greater scientific community through presentations, documentation, web dissemination, and research papers
Actively seek and develop creative solutions for problem solving and standardization

Note: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This description reflects management’s assignment of essential functions; it does not proscribe or restrict the tasks that may be assigned.
Required Education and Experience
PhD in computational biology, bioinformatics, machine learning, statistics, applied mathematics, computer science/electrical engineering, or related field or equivalent combination of degree and experience is required
Experience implementing and applying machine learning models, specifically deep learning approaches, to biological image data, using Python
Command of current machine learning literature
Demonstrated success working on interdisciplinary projects
Demonstrated proficiency in scientific computing including Python and Linux/UNIX environment

Preferred Education and Experience
Comfortable designing and sharing their own scientific computing stack
Knowledge of image-processing and/or image analysis applications
Able to provide expertise on a range of scientific computing problem settings, including application of appropriate models and data requirements
Experience implementing and applying machine learning models with PyTorch Lightning
Familiarity with high-throughput biological data
Strong communication skills and ability to work in a collaborative, multi-disciplinary environment
Experience utilizing software engineering practices such as version management, build management and testing
Experience using common computational biology methods, tools, and data resources

Physical Demands
Fine motor movements in fingers/hands to operate computers and other office equipment

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work
This role is currently able to work remotely due to COVID-19 and our focus on employee safety. We are a Washington State employer, and remote work must be performed in Washington State. We continue to evaluate the safest options for our employees. As restrictions are lifted in relation to COVID-19, this role will return to work onsite.

Additional Comments
**Please note, this opportunity sponsors work visas**
**Please note, this opportunity offers relocation assistance**

It is the policy of the Allen Institute to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, the Allen Institute will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. We offer competitive pay, generous benefits, and a dynamic work environment. The Allen Institute for Cell Science is an equal opportunity employer

JobTitle: data scientist lead - Production AI, AI/ML Evolution
Content_text:
Job Posting
: Nov 10, 2021
Job Posting End Date
: Dec 11, 2021
Location
: US-WA-Seattle-Starbucks Support Center
Starbucks - Data Analytics
Job Summary and Mission:
As a lead technologist for the AI/ML ModelOps Program, you will lead and develop Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning solutions (real-time customer facing, supply chain optimization, forecasts, IoT and others) while creating standardization and scalability across environments so that development, training, and deployment processes can run consistently, and in a platform-agnostic manner.
Leveraging your previous experience, we will enable you to:
Develop novel retail AI/ML prototypes to prove tech feasibility & showcase potential solutions.
Work independently & cross-functionally to build & scale relevant analytics solutions.
Build repeatable patterns, through code libraries, processes, etc., to increase the team efficiency of the AI/ML solution scaling process.
Evaluate & translate unstructured questions from business teams to data problems and help define roadmaps for potential data solutions.
Drive adoption of analytics data products & insights across business teams.
Establish yourself & the team as subject matter experts and trainers in AI/ML across departments.
Influence decisions by providing technical consultation and direction to stakeholders.
Recommend new technology trends and innovative products/features to the enterprise.
Train and re-train ML systems and models as and when necessary.
Extend, enrich, and standardize existing AI/ML frameworks and libraries.
We’d love to hear from people with:
3-5 years’ experience as a Machine Learning Engineer for production systems, Data Scientist, or similar role
Real world expertise in Reinforcement Learning and/or Deep Learning methods
Ability to develop robust code in Python, Java, and R, with familiarity in common Data Science / ML packages
Experience developing real-time AI/ML solutions
Experience working in Spark, SQL, NoSQL, or Map-Reduce environments; explicit Data Engineering experience is a bonus
Experience with modern cloud architecture ML patterns; Azure experience is a bonus
Understanding of AI/ML application management processes, such as ModelOps/MLOps/DevOps
Retail, customer loyalty, and/or eCommerce industry experience preferred
Understanding of data structures, data modeling, and software architecture
Deep knowledge of math, probability, statistics, and algorithms
Strong analytical & problem-solving skills, with ability to communicate & influence business teams
BS in Computer Science, Mathematics, or similar technical field; Master’s or advanced degree preferred
Let us give you the opportunity to be part of something bigger than yourself. It’s time for you to #beapartner. Apply today!
Starbucks and its brands are an equal opportunity employer of all qualified individuals.
We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Starbucks Corporation is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at 206-318-0660 or via email at applicantaccommodation@starbucks.com

JobTitle: newSr. Data Analytics Power BI Developer
Content_text:
Opportunity Summary
We are looking for talented people to join our team: Responsible, Approachable, Diverse, Innovative, Customer-Driven, Accountable, and always Learning.
We are looking for a Senior Data Analytics Power BI Developer who will help us create and integrate extensive data analytics and reporting, as well as be part of championing the Data Insights & Advanced Analytics Center of Excellence (CoE). The Sr Power BI Developer will demonstrate specialized skills in the Power BI platform and development methodology with the ability to contribute to the strategic development of Power BI reports, applications and data visualizations across programs.
Why you’re the perfect addition to our Team (about you):
Development
You have the knowledge to design and develop data analytics visualizations enabled by Microsoft Power BI reports and Dashboards (Operational, Strategic & Analytical) including data set ingestion and transformation, Data Modeling, Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) using the appropriate report templates depicting status of key performance indicators (KPIs) and other important business metrics for an organization to make data driven decisions
You can work with cross-functional teams to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business needs
You can build data models, technical and functional documentation with business partners
You can translate business requirements into specifications that will be used to implement the required reports and dashboards, created from potentially multiple data sources
You know how to transition developed reports and dashboards to interactive/automated dashboards using Power BI
You can provide support as required to ensure the availability and optimal performance of developed reports and dashboards for both external and internal users
You ensure proper configuration management and change controls are implemented.
You can design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes
You have experience in creating reports, dashboards using POWER BI Desktop and Server and maintaining Power BI dashboards on servers.
You can extract and analyze data using PowerQuery, PivotTables, MS Excel, POWER BI and SSAS.
You know how to design, develop, update and optimize Power BI dashboards, reports and scorecards to meet business requirements.
You can design, publish and maintain Power BI data models with many interrelated tables connected.
You can mentor junior team members
You are a champion for overall Data Insights & Advanced Analytics CoE for the organization
Basic Function:
You can create analytical solutions (reports, dashboards and visualizations) that deliver actionable information to business leaders
You are highly motivated and passionate Data Analytics and Power BI Developer, with some competencies in data modelling and data analytics. You will help us drive internal initiatives on the Microsoft Azure Data Platform.
Added bonus if you have strong knowledge within the Power BI, Microsoft Azure Data Platform, within the Energy, Utilities, or Construction / Fabrication industries
Responsibilities:
You understand business areas overall data sources, IT and business priorities and success measures/KPIs
You can design, developing and maintaining business intelligence solutions, based on Power BI and other Azure tools
You’re able to use analytical thinking for translating data into informative visuals and reports.
You can ensure that solution exhibits high levels of performance, security, scalability maintainability, appropriate reusability and reliability upon deployment
You can maintain technical skills and knowledge, keeping up to date with market trends and competitive insights
Additional Experience:
Bachelors’ or Masters’ degree within IT or similar.
Professional certification within IT, Power BI/Business intelligence, or Data Management/Science/Analytics.
Experience can compensate for formal education.
What make the perfect candidate qualified for this opportunity?
Professional:
Experience: 5+ years of data analytics experience including success with development using the Microsoft Business Intelligence Stack. 4+ years of success in in data preparation, data gateway and data warehousing projects.
Relationship Building: Experience in managing various stakeholder relationships to get consensus on solution/projects.
Problem Solving: Ability to solve customer problems through cloud technologies.
Teamwork: Ability to be a strong team player, working in cross functional environment.
Collaboration and Communication: Acknowledged for driving decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts and ensuring follow through with exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
Leadership: Experience mentoring other more junior data analytics resources including being part of a Data Analytics Center of Excellence or a Data Analytics Community.
Minimum Qualifications:
Development with the Microsoft Business Intelligence Stack (Power BI, SSAS, SSRS, SSIS). 4 years.
Database experience, with a focus on SQL. 4 years
Knowledge on Tabular Cubes, DAX.
Experience in business analysis or data analysis
Experience with statistical tools and analytical skills
Experience in process / workflow documentation and ability to evaluate business processes and identify opportunities for improvement
Azure BI offerings (like Azure data factory, Power BI, Synapse, Machine learning) or equivalent technology
Desired Qualifications:
Leadership: Experience leading more junior resources and having been part of leading a Data Analytics Center of Excellence team.
Python
Azure Data Factory (ADF)
Azure Data Lake Storage
Azure Blob Storage
Synapse
Databricks
Azure Machine Learning
IoT Data with a focus on Oil & Gas
ADF source code version control using Azure DevOps or Git
Information and Data Security
Data Governance
Experience:
Data Analytics Development: 5 years
SQL: 4 years (Preferred)
Data warehouse: 3 years (Preferred)
Preferred Qualifications
BS or higher in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or another quant-focused field or 6+ years of industry experience
Unique mix of technical, analytical, strategic, and program management skills
Able to understand and translate business and product questions into data insights
Strong background in cloud and enterprise services or applications
Able to articulate vision and benefits of projects to business and technical partners
Proficient in advanced Excel functions (e.g., creating formulas, pivot tables) and Power BI
Self-motivated, agile, and driven to think out-of-the-box
“Working Leader;” must be able to lead work while delivering business insights and analytics across various stakeholders
Effective influencing and listening skills, as well as flexibility, a strong work ethic and strategic thinking are valued assets
Exposure and business understanding of core financial and operational processes preferred
Perks
Supportive and fun work environment!
Paid holidays
Medical, dental, vision benefits
401 (k)
Coffee, tea, and snacks
NAES is committed to supporting a culture with unique perspectives and backgrounds. We value Individual Differences in Each other in an effort to create a brighter future in the power generation industry. We strive to attract and retain employees by offering competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits package (including retirement) and promotional opportunities.
Physical Requirements & Working Conditions

Fit for Duty

Performance
When it comes to our customers NAES employees take ownership to perform at the highest standard. We also care about our co-workers and know they deserve the same respect. Our goal is to exceed the needs of our customers with absolute intergity.
About NAES
At NAES, you’ll find engaging and challenging career opportunities in the power generation, renewable energy and industrial construction industry. At every level of the company, we share a common goal: To instill confidence in our clients through our steadfast commitment to safety, integrity and quality of work.
NAES is largest independent operator of power facilities in the industry, operating more than 190 power plants throughout the United States, Canada, Mexico and the UK that span all technologies and provide over 49 GW of capacity. With the strength of 4000 people, our growing family of companies now addresses the entire life cycle of power generation and other industrial plants.
NAES Safe
Safety is a very important value of NAES; those employed with NAES are expected to be mentally alert and work safely at all times, following safety rules and procedures. Additionally, employees have an obligation to abide by all safety warnings and posted safety signs, on company property.
It is the practice of NAES to seek employees of the highest quality and to select the individuals on the basis of merit and competence, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, disability, military status or affiliation protected under USERRA, or any other basis of discrimination prohibited by applicable local, state and federal law.
